Reviews.Title: “Great little trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: SalpalAndover_Nj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manhattan Club March 7 - 10. We had a great time. The location could'nt be better!! We had a one bedroom 2 bath penthouse suite on the 28th floor. The unit was very clean, spacious, & nicely decorated. Not one complaint. If you have the opportunity rent a penthouse suite, its worth it!!! Our bed was so comfortable!!! Nice Bose stereo system in your suite, 2 plasma tvs, small kitchenette with all the essentials except there is no stove but who wants to cook when you can wak to all the fabulous restaurants. Parking is only $28/day which is'nt bad but you can't take your car out or you have to pay again. We used cabs to get around to places we could'nt walk to like a couple of the museums, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Steven B
Reviews.Content: We stayed two week nights in March, 2012. The hotel staff was helpful in getting places and in making suggestions for things to do during a short stay. The bed was comfortable and the showers had plenty of warm water. We didn't use the microwave or sink, but it was night to have the refrigerator for keeping drinks cold. We were not too far from the elevator and were concerned that a constant bell ringing would keep us awake, but the bells were either disconnected or very quiet so it wasn't a sleeping problem at all. The location was great, right near Carnegie Hall (undergoing some renovation) and a short walk from most places we wanted to see. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything, so feels like home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: jian9898
Reviews.Content: From the valets out front to the front desk, consierge and house keeping- an amazing team of people who are truly there to assist their guests and owners. Our first visit almost 2 years ago was so welcoming that we did purchase. We only bought at a very low level, and still have never regretted our decision. We often use our nights for a one-night stay, and believe it or not- each time we stop, people greet us by name. The rooms vary in size from an efficiency size to much suites with separate bedrooms- you choose your needs and desires. We're not in the room much since it is the BIG APPLE, and we have never been disappointed. Beds are comfortable, coffee, tea and popcorn are in the rooms with the extra sink and microwave. Bathrooms are nice. The accessible rooms are very large and truly wheelchair accessible, including the shower. Inside rooms have, obviously, less of a view, but if you are out to dinner and a show until after 11 or midnight or later- who really needs that! AT 56th you are in view of Carnegie Hall, 2 blocks from Central Park, 2 blocks from the New York City Center-worth checking out- and near many, many wonderful restaurants. We love having a "home in the city" where we are always welcomed with a smile and true respect.

Reviews.Title: “Great, after changing rooms”
Reviews.Author: bijou59
Reviews.Content: Used my timeshare in NYC for the first time. Excited to have a full week in NYC, pre paid....first room was not renovated, had an old fold out couch. Bathroom had peeling paint, the old tub....not sure if it was mold, but around the tub looked icky. They brought us a cot to use until they could change our room the next day....had them waive my entire daily fee for the week it was so bad....second room, much better layout, and new couch. Renovated bath....after the room change, I was very happy. In the end, it was a great week!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Iris Y
Reviews.Content: As others already commented the MC has a great location for Broadway, Central Park and the Museums. Thank's to NYC efficient transportation system you can easily move around the city with no effort at all. The suite is a little bit small but nice and cozy. Very compfortable bed. The bathroom is not the best since it lacks space around the sink and doesn't have a hand set in addition to the shower, which could have a better flow. Staff are freindly and helpful. You get a small kichinette with micro wave oven, coffe maker, refrigrator and supply of coffee. It is a very good choice for RCI exchange.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Lucille B
Reviews.Content: I have been an owner at the Manhattan Club in NYC for three years. I have stayed numerous times with no problems. My last visit on March 16, 2012 resulted in waking up with bed bug bites. The hotel staff called in an exterminator who said he saw no evidence of the bugs in the room. However, no one could explain how we got the ugly bites which were on our bodies! I don't feel the management handled this situation properly. There were no guarantees given that the room would be treated or any compensation given to us for the inconvenience. I hope we didn't bring any of the bugs home with us. I have a real problem going back to the hotel for my time share because I am not confident that The Manhattan Club has followed through with extermination treatment. (Stay out of room 226!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location For Visiting Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CityDave
Reviews.Content: We had planned this trip to Manhattan back in Oct. 2011. Having been to NY 2 times before we felt we had a feel for the area and where we wanted to stay. I reviewed The Manhattan Club here on TA and had some concerns but felt it was worth a try. I have a time share in Las Vegas with HGV and used some points with RCI to stay at TMC for 7 nights 2/24-3/02. It was a very good trade. We arrived on a wet and rainy Friday evening. From the moment we steped out of the taxi to the second we left we had no regrets other then we had to return to our home in California All of the staff at TMC made us feel welcome and were very helpful. I would like to give a tumbs up to Jerry at the front desk who greeted us when we checked in and was very helpful and answered all of my questions. Great going Jerry :-) I also would like to thank all of the staff from the Door Man who help us arrange a return ride to JFK that was better then a taxi, the house staff who made sure our room was cleaned and in order every day and did some extra things we did not expect, the fast security man who fixed a faulty room safe in a timely manner, and the Bell Hops who made sure our luggage was brought up to our room and put away, to holding it in storage before we left so we could spend our last few hours taking in the scenes of New York. Now for the facts. 1. Check in was fast and without issues. Same with check out. 2. We never had a issue with the elevators. I can see were they do become busy at check out 3. We did have a slight sewer smell in the hallway but it was not something I would not expect in a older building. Never in the room!!!!! 4. We had a One Bedroom Suite on the 22nd floor (2219) that gave us a small view up 7th Ave. and Central Park. 5. The room had a private bedroom with a king bed and a tub/shower bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the room had plenty of space. The closet has a ironing board and iron. The bathroom has a hair dryer and a adjustable vanity mirror. The window can be opened to let in some freah air. Also a flat screen tv. The bathroom was large and layout worked for me. 6. We had a small living room with a hideabed that my college age daughter found to be a pain. Putting some extra blankets that where in the room made it worth while. I would not expect a older and heavy adult to find sleeping on this bed a good thing but what do you want for a hideabed. I have one at home that I would not sleep on. This room also also has a flat screen tv and a view out the window. 7. The kitchenette has a dishwasher, frig, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, all of the dishes you would need. THC provides diswasher soap, coffee, tea, popcorn, suger and creamer that was replaced as it was used. 8. A small dinining table is near the front door. 9.A smaller bathroom also comes with this room, It has a shower and also comes with a hair dryer and a adjustable vanity mirror. The toiletries are Bath and Body Works and are replaced as they are used. 10. TMC does charge $30.00 a night fee. Not sure what you get for the money? We did not use the gym being we walked our feet off or eat upstairs. The business center came in handy for printing our boarding passes. We did get the phone calls to do a timeshare preview but I just did not answer the phone. The location of TMC was everything you would want. Everything was in walking distance. Subway stations are just around the corner or if needed a taxi is just ouside the door. Plenty of places to eat and you have a Whole Foods on Columbus Circle that great for stocking your kitchenette. They also have some great ready made meals that can help keep cost down. As for the size of the rooms I would say it was large by NY standards. When we return to New York this will be Hotel we will be staying at. Great job TMC.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway in NYC”
Reviews.Author: My1stlove
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Manhattan club February 2012. The "door staff" was very helpful from parking our car, unloading our luggage and storing it until our room was ready. The front desk staff was average, not overly friendly like the "door staff" was. We were able to get into our room at 4:30p.m, 1/2 late. Our room was a "soft" suite, with 2 bathrooms. facing Carnegie Hall. The room was "nice". Not wonderful, not fabulous, not outstanding, just nice. We rented this from a friend of ours who was an owner. The place is in need of an update. We were NOT happy with the lack of services, no room service, limited bar time, limited breakfast. The breakfast was nothing to be desired, overpriced and poorly displayed. We went to the adjoining hotel for a wonderfully displayed, very good, served breakfast with a view, for a few dollars more. The housekeeping department did a wonderful job and was very friendly. The next stay in NYC will be at a full service hotel for the same price, better view and updated facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, located perfectly at Times Square”
Reviews.Author: kanasri
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel which is located centrally at Times Square. Across from Carnegie Hall. Walking distance from times square. Excellent .

Reviews.Title: “New York Trip”
Reviews.Author: Harry47087
Reviews.Content: This place has the ideal location for Manhattan, close to lots of entertainment, great restaurants, cultural attractions, and best of all, Central Park which is a great place year-round to really getaway from the hustle and bustle of the City, but still 'people watch' and enjoy the outdoors, especially if you have kids or like to recreate with lots of open space. The Manhattan Club has many amenities, and beats any hotel room in terms of space, kitchenette facilities, and areas to relax with no extra charge. Most of the units are spacious, nicely furnished, and well serviced. The location is perfect for walking to many entertainment and dining options, and close to several public transit stops.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for shows and museums”
Reviews.Author: GaryHiker
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club is the perfect place if your destination is a Broadway show, Lincoln Center, or the museums by the park. In my case it was near to my mid town business destinations as well. My room was small but nice and it had everything that I needed including a small kitchenette area. The service was good. The only shortfall in the place is the elevator service which is slow. A strategy would be to stay low and use the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Penhouse Suites at the MC”
Reviews.Author: D0ntFenceMeIn
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to be gifted a night at one of the MC's penthouse suites. These are found on the hotel's 27th floor and above, and require a special elevator/key card to be reached. I'm not familiar with the rest of the hotel/time share accomodations, but my guess is the penthouse suites are somewhat more snazzy. Our suite was not huge but plenty spacious; galley-efficiency kitchen (coffee provided), sitting area with pull-out queen sofa, bedroom, and two very large bathrooms. The bathrooms are fabulous. The glass/tile walk-in shower in the master bath was, on its own, almost as big as a whole bathroom! Plenty of upscale toiletries are provided; the linens are very good quality and the bed comfy. The suite was clean and quiet. The quality/character of the lobby was not what I expected -- small, and always seemed rather noisy and crowded. We arrived at 4 o'clock check-in time, and the line at the front desk was quite daunting; basically almost backed up to the front door. Luckily, as we were going up to the penthouse suites which have their own check-in procedure, we avoided the line, but I felt sorry for those who could not. And, as everyone says, the elevator situation is totally inadequate to handle the volume of guests. We enjoyed our stay and would return to the penthouse suites. They are comfortable and the Club's location is excellent. I'm not so sure, however, if I would return to stay in one of the other lodging options.

Reviews.Title: “excellent room/suite”
Reviews.Author: ljkfmk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this fabulous time share accomodation for the second time. Lovely accomodation with well appointed room, kitchenette and huge beautiful bathrooms in our suite. Worth the price just to have those bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay during festive season”
Reviews.Author: 2dtropic
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Christmas for a week with two teenage children. We got a studio suite on the 23rd floor. The layout of the room worked out well, as it allowed me to leave the bedside lights on without disturbing those on the sofa bed. Our room and bathroom was clean. Furnishings were modern and not worn. Housekeeping staff was great. We had no problems waiting for the elevators. The bar/lounge at the very top floor was a nice retreat. Best feature of the hotel is the location. Only issue was the heat in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and staff”
Reviews.Author: L0vet0travel433
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week over New Years with our two children. We had a fabulous time and the Manhattan Club was the perfect place to experience New York City. We stayed in a one bedroom, one bath and had plenty of space foe everyone. The room was immaculate and the furnishings were very nice. We had everything we needed in the kitchen. We felt very safe and the staff were excellent. John is so helpful and nice and my children still speak of him since we returned home. I wish I could remember our housekeepers name because she was fantastic too. She cleaned room 1208 from the 28th thru 2nd if management would like to share the review with her. She was friendly and the room was always sparkling when we returned. We will definitely return to the MC when we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Manhatten club new York”
Reviews.Author: Vicki B
Reviews.Content: We are staying here right now! Certainly a fabulous location! Don't agree with reviews of not being clean- yes a little worn - but in a comfy way and spotless bathrooms! Couldn't be happier with the place!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for New Years”
Reviews.Author: 645propane
Reviews.Content: Location. Location, Location, perfect for all New Year festivities, 10 min stroll to Times Square, 5 min to the park, room was large, very clean, all staff very good, would go back anytime, but my wife said I had to much fun, only negative was a noise at night from the elevators because all else was quiet...also my wife trapped one roach in the middle of the living room

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui K
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 4 nights in a one bedroom, 2 bathroom room with our 12 year old daughter. What a fantastic location and hotel. The room was large enough for all of us. We had read about the slow elevator but I would have to say with 26 floors and 186 rooms that it was not that slow in the time we stayed. Housekeeping was great and answered all our calls very quickly when we made them (and we stayed over the Christmas period so you might think it would be a little slower). We will definitely stay here again if we return to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this one, not clean and outdated.”
Reviews.Author: Travelonbike
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend who has a time share; my daughter and I have stayed at beautiful hotels worldwide and are not snobs, and we hated this place. The rooms were dirty, the carpeting, upholstery, countertops etc were dirty as well. The staff unhelpful and unfriendly. Rooms are dark and dreary. Filthy would be a better word when it comes to the upholstery! When we walked into the lobby late at night I did not feel safe and felt like I was in a very sketchy place. The halls were dismal and dark, some areas were VERY narrow, could barely walk through without banging luggage against the wall. Luckily, I was not the paying customer, I would have been furious and appalled at the conditions. You could not pay me to stay here again. My friend offered me the place for additional days but we could not stay any longer than one night. I didn't sleep a wink, the fold out was uncomfortable. I would rather pay $500/night somewhere else and feel clean and secure than stay at the Manhattan club for a second. I don't write reviews normally but felt I had to in this case. Trust me you can pay less and have a significanly better experience!!! Previous reviewer was right Howard Johnson's or a Holiday Inn would be a better choice! You can pass on this one!

Reviews.Title: “Please read before you book your stay here”
Reviews.Author: belair100
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel solely based on the location. I should have done the research first. This is a time share hotel. I was not a time share guest but instead I paid about $400 per night and I expected it to be a great experience but it was not. It all started about a week before my arrival. I kept on getting 877 number calls on my cell phone. I finally called back only to find out that it was the Manhattan Club calling. They wanted to schedule a tour of the facilities. I told them that I was a hotel guest and why would I want to tour the facilities and asked them not to call me anymore? It gets worse. Upon check in my hotel package included free parking. The woman at the front desk could not seem to understand this very simple concept. She kept on saying that there was an envelope for me from the manager and she did not know what was in it(almost like I was entitled to some sort of prize). At this point it felt very cheesy and like a time share tour. It turns out my envelope contained my parking vouchers. They asked for my driver's license and took it in the back to make a copy of it. I travel often and I NEVER have anyone make a copy of my license. They also took an imprint of my credit card which is common. Go to their website and look at their choice of words to describe the room like sumptuous. I can tell you the rooms are old and outdated. They also are very small even though I was booked into a jr suite. The bathroom is brass and dated like the 1980's. My carpet and furniture were dirty. My phone rang and it was a gentleman asking what I thought of the room. I told him I was not happy and he said he would get back to me with a solution. I unfortunately did not get his name and no one called back to follow up. I proceeded to leave but had to wait 15 minutes for an elevator. I am not kidding as you look at other reviews you will see this come up over and over as they do not have enough elevators for the demand. I think what made my stay awful was on my last day I was under the weather. My phone kept on ringing and I finally picked it up only to be asked when I wanted to tour the ambassador club. Even though I was paying full rate and not on a reduced rate or being giving some sort of incentive they continued to harass me about a tour of this property. This is unacceptable. If you are visiting as a time share guest you might be ok with all of this. I was not. The parking is unusual. Even if your room comes with free parking you need to pay each day at the front desk with a voucher. I found out the hard way on my way to a meeting. They brought my car around and I gave them the green claim check and a tip. Instead of giving me my keys they said I need to give them a receipt that I paid for parking. I told them I left a credit card imprint at the front desk and that I still had three more nights so why would I pay every time I leave. They said that you need to pay each time you leave and present a receipt. They acted like I would leave and not pay for parking. I had to go back to the front desk and wait in line. I was so happy to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: valentine214
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a one night stay at the Manhattan Club. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that was more than impressive. The room was clean and very nicely appointed. Two bathrooms is just unbelivable for a Manhattan hotel. The location of the hotel is very convenient to all of the sites in the city. The only thing that we did not like is that we were unable to regulate the temperture in the room. The hotel staff were very helpful and eagar to please. The lobby was very nicely decorated for Christmas. We are definately looking forward to returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BillSweeney1
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club is located just below Central Park, across the street from Carnegie Hall. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are spacious for NYC. It's any easy walk to Times Square or any Broadway show.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Peppermint123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a studio for 4 nights. Location of property - fantastic. However, I would not stay here again. The room was plenty big for two people, but I hated the air conditioning/ heating set up. When we were there, the hotel was set to "HEAT". I wanted to put on the A/C; however, that was not possible! It was warm and stuffy in the room and all I could do was open the two windows 4" up. I called the front desk and they said the hotel was set to HEAT only. What an archaic system. Also, the water pressure and volume of water in the shower was dreadful - not good for women with long hair. The kitchen was nice and rooms were cleaned well each day.

Reviews.Title: “There were some great things, and some not so great!”
Reviews.Author: MMBBOULDER
Reviews.Content: I can understand why people give the Manhattan Club varying reviews. It really depends on what you focus on. The good: The location was fabulous. The lobby was clean and bright. We had a 1 bedroom suite which had 2 full bathrooms and was enormous by Manhattan standards and updated/decorated quite nicely. The kitchenette had a coffeemaker that they provided daily coffee for, a dishwasher, fridge, microwave, and plates/utensils. We could not have asked for more and there was a nice grocery store within a half block. We were able to have nice breakfasts in our room and save time and money. The Bad: the elevators (as mentioned by other people) were ridiculous- you can't run a hotel with elevators that take 15 minutes! One of the showers in our full bath didn't work. This didn't bother us, because we just used the other shower but if you were sharing a room between 2 families or couples that each wanted their privacy, it would have been a big deal. The noise was pretty bad from the service elevators in our room, but we used noise machines and ear plugs so we were able to get by. Other members of our family had the smaller rooms, and they were MUCH smaller. Upgrade to the 1BR if you can. The pull out couch was NOT comfortable at all. It didn't bother our small kids, but there is no way an adult could have slept on that thing. Again, we didn't complain because it was fine for our kids as they don't weigh enough to feel how thin the mattress was!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and more than adequate rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Cfedorick
Reviews.Content: For us this was a great value because we rented from an owner for three nights over thanksgiving weekend. The costs would have been much more if we hadn't. We stayed on the 20th floor in a Junior Executive Suite and were very pleased with size. We stay in the city several weekends a year and this is the largest we've stayed in. The location is awesome, subway is real close, plenty of food choices. I have 2 complaints although not significant to us. The elevators were slow a various times during the day. Many people were willing to ride up the elevator just to get back down. And do not attempt to use them during checkout time (11 am). The guest directory is a little misleading when it talks about the club lounge- the continental breakfast is not included with your stay, it is $14.95. The tv in the room was even more misleading. We are going to stay here again in March in the one bedroom suite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, high price for value.”
Reviews.Author: itsvick
Reviews.Content: Had to call to have the heat turned on 2 of the 3 nights we were there. Missed our wake up call. Had everything we needed though and quiet. Overall good.

Reviews.Title: “The Manhattan Club”
Reviews.Author: Leo C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a one week stay (Nov. 12-19,2011) at the Manhattan Club in the heart of mid-town Manhattan. The staff were courteous, helpful and friendly. Our studio suite was clean. We stayed as guests of another person and so had no choice in booking the room but what we had was suitable. I definitely recommend this location. Rockefeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Times Square, the theater district, Central Park are all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: CaFaHi
Reviews.Content: I just returned from three days spent at the Manhattan Club in New York City. It is located within twenty minutes walking distance of Times Square, the theater district, Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping, the Hudson River and much more!. The rooms are very clean and well appointed. The service staff is accommodating and the concierge staff are extremely helpful. There are lots of good moderately priced eating establishments within a couple of blocks of the hotel. There is a subway stop within a couple of blocks and Central Park is only two blocks away. There is a gym and business center and free wifi in the rooms. All rooms have a kitchen area with a microwave, small refrigerator, sink, dishes and silverware.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Free_Skier
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the Manhattan Club through an exchange with RCI. I had booked a 1 bedroom and a studio unit. Both units were very nice, with the exception of the curtains in the studio unit. We brought to the attention of the front desk staff that the studio unit did not have a black out curtain. As the hotel is located on busy streets, a black out curtain is necessary if you are going to get any rest, unless noise and lights don't bother you. The desk staff did not respond to our request and so the couple that spent the 4 nights in the studio unit had to suffer through the noise and lights. They did go out and purchase ear plugs for the second night, but the fact that the staff made no attempt to respond to our request is not acceptable for a hotel of this calaber. The location is great...10 minute walk to Time Square and you could see Central Park from our 1 bedroom suite. The lounge upstairs is nice, but the bartender only knows how to pour 6 ounce drinks. The price reflects this at $16 a glass, but if all you want is a quick drink before supper it doesn't rally work well. Others have commented on the sales people, we did not find them a problem. We told them we were not interested and they left us alone for the duration of our trip. The concierge and front lobby staff are great at assisting with taxi service. There is a great Thai restaurant just down the block - the Topaz - you have to go there if you like Thai food - best curry dish we had ever had. Enjoyed our trip and would recommend the Manhattan Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good sized room”
Reviews.Author: CasaMurguia
Reviews.Content: We were struggling to find a hotel in the city that was not over $500 a night, we were on a business trip but still we sis not want to pay that kind of rate. We had a quick review of Trip Advisor of the Manhattan Club and decided to give it a go. The hotel was easily found and very bright so you could not miss it. Check was fine, not the most helpful but then what else do you get in New York, the staff were not very rude but not very pleasant either. I had a 1 bed room, the room was big and comfortable, with a kitchenette which I did not use. The decoration was dated and the hallways smelled for lack of air. The bathroom was small but again big enough for 1, the quality of the wares within the bathroom was not the greatest at all, they could really invents in some better supplies. Check was fine, again not the best of manners and the bell guys were over helpful because of the tip they expected, they were quite rude when not tipped on placing the bags in storage but this improved on collection. Overall the location was great, the room comfortable and clean, the dÃ©cor was poor but for New York I guess this was good for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room size”
Reviews.Author: LL123500
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week booking through RCI. Whilst it was a little pricey, i think it was comparable to other hotels in the area. It was clean and well appointed, having the junior suite we had a small kitchenette and lounge area. Great for those nights you want to stay in -more like a home than a hotel. We were called up by RCI to attend an information night but if you tell them your spouse is not with you they are not interested. The location is fantastic -it is just round the corner from the subway station (N, Q, R line), and a very short walk to Columbus circle, the department stores on 5th Ave. Times square is also walkable (20minutes). We took a taxi to and from LGA -one trip costing close to $40 exc tip and the other slightly over 30 (exc tip). It is very traffic dependant.

Reviews.Title: “Good-size room and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Manhattan Club for two nights in September. Please note that reviews on this site are from both those who have stayed at the club as time share holders and those who have rented a hotel room. The hotel room does not incur additional charges for housekeeping, which is mentioned in some reviews, or at least our hotel room did not incur a charge. We secured our room for an excellent rate on Hotwire and thus did not know this was a time share until after we paid Hotwire. I am uninterested in the time share concept and was less than enthusiastic to receive a "welcome" letter when we checked in, inviting us to learn more about the time share possibilities. I felt the same way when a phone call came to our room, inviting us again to a presentation. (I have suggested to Hotwire that they indicate on their site that time shares are included in their hotel offerings so that the buyer is aware.) That said, we found our second floor room to be clean and a good size for Manhattan. The bed was extremely comfortable and there was plenty of storage space ... except in the bathroom, which had minimal space for toiletries. The main drawback was the room's location. It faced a brick wall, so no natural light came in. We felt as if we had entered a bear's den. Carpeting in the second floor corridor resembled a leopard print and seemed a strange interior design choice. To access the nearby guest elevators required using our key card to enter the business office area where the elevators stopped. Elevators are quite slow, so we often had to leave this area and take a walk to the service elevators, located in a dreary back hall that had no air conditioning -- a major drawback because of the high temperatures that weekend in New York. The hotel's location is great -- near Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, etc. -- with plenty of good restaurants and cafes in the vicinity. That is truly a major plus. It is well worth staying here if you can get a good rate, and, based on some other reviews and our experience, secure a room above the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Shato296
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but very expensive. Specially when you get a phone call the minute you check in to see if you are interested in properties owned by the hotel. Very distracting when you have reservations for dinner and a show. Other than that the room was comfy and th elocation was near very nice restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: snavefam
Reviews.Content: We had friends join us for 3 days out the the week that we were there and sharing the one bedroom suite with them still gave us plenty of room. We each had our own bathroom and although they had to put the mattress from the sofa hide-a-bed on the floor for comfort, they said they slept well after doing that. Having a kitchenette meant snacks and drinks in our room before heading out for a night on the town (an excellent opportunity to save some $$$). If you're all about location, this can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the middle of it all!”
Reviews.Author: Najebo
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 14 nights from September 10 to September 24 2011. This was our fourth visit to New York City, and we chose this accommodation for its great location; we were 4 adults in an executive studio unit. The Manhattan Club is a great place to stay as it is right in the middle of it all: 2 blocks from Central Park, a 10-minute walk to Times Square, itâ€™s right in the center of the Theater district and several subway lines minutes away (N, Q, R right around the corner and 1, 2, 3 at Colombus Circle, a couple blocks away). The check-in went very smoothly and we got the unit we had specifically requested a week prior to our arrival. We were on the 20th floor, which was great. Our unit was just as expected: very spacious. We had no view whatsoever (a huge brick wall), but the good thing about it is that it was extremely quiet. We were never woken up by those city sounds and we really appreciated that. The bed and pillows are very comfortable and so was the sofa bed. We tried both because we were 4 adults and thought it was only fair to switch every now and then. The kitchenette is practical for drinks and snacks but there is no cooktop or regular oven. I guess you can heat up some soup in the micro-wave but we didnâ€™t. Housekeeping gives you popcorn and ground coffee every day, so you wonâ€™t need to buy coffee. If you are a Starbucks addict, thereâ€™s one just around the corner. The dÃ©cor was fine, nothing really special. The bathroom was â€œnew york smallâ€� and lacked storage space. We had to have all our beauty products on the floor and the hallway console became our make- up/hair drying area. Housekeeping did a great job; unlike other timeshare properties, they refresh your unit every day. The hotel is well kept: after a day in the filthy new york subway, itâ€™s very pleasant to come â€œhomeâ€� to a very clean and neat hotel. Apparently thereâ€™s a gym but we never used it. On the 26th floor, thereâ€™s a guest lounge with very comfy sofas and chairs. From 2 to 4pm (or maybe 12 to 4) they provide complimentary Starbucks coffee and cookies. I had read many complaints about the elevators. Most of the time we didnâ€™t have to wait that long. The only time we did was check-out mornings because if the elevator has reached a certain weight before getting to your floor, it wonâ€™t stop at your floor. So we decided to call the elevator going up, weâ€™d go up to the 26th and back down to the lobby and it was way quicker this way. Keep that in mind on Friday and Saturday mornings! We liked the Manhattan Club very much for its location and its cleanliness, so we will definitely stay there again when we go back to NY. Some extra practical info: - Groceries: thereâ€™s a Morton Williams a block away (225 West 57th Street). Itâ€™s small but has everything you need: we stocked up on watered bottles, juice, milk, fruit and veggies for salads. - Wi-fi: itâ€™s free at the Manhattan Club, so bring your laptop itâ€™s great to help plan your day. - Laundry: if you stay a while (we stayed 2 weeks) you may need to do some laundry at some point. We went to a Laundromat on W. 50th between 9th and 10th avenue. Itâ€™s very clean and the lady running the place is very helpful. Itâ€™s $4.50 for a large washer and $0.25 per 7 minutes of drying. You have plenty of eateries in the area to have dinner while your laundry is being done. - Concierge: the person at the concierge desk is very helpful. If you need a map of Central Park you can get one there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location with Reasonable Rates”
Reviews.Author: VancouverDolce
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Manhattan, choosing this hotel was a shot in the dark. And having just spent 5 nights there - we would stay there again anytime and recommend it to all my friends. The location is excellent - within walking distance to so many of the midtown sites, all the theaters, Times Square, Carnegie Hall, Rockefeller Centre & excellent shopping (both on a budget & not!). Also, the hotel is within blocks of the hop-on/hop-off tour bus locations (which we strongly recommend!), great dining (again, both on a budget & not!). Best deli "Carnegie" just around the corner and too many more to mention. The hotel rooms have kitchenettes - great for morning coffee, drinks and snacks! The hotel and rooms are a little tired (wallpaper peeling, smalls carpet stains) - but who cares! The rooms are clean, beds comfortable (though no king size available - queen only!) and price is right. Internet is available in the rooms and free. Staff are helpful getting cabs, directions and dining suggestions! There is a gym, fitness center and lounge/bar - no restaurant (thus the kitchenettes!). They offer a continental breakfast, though we never tried it....way to many other great options for dining near the hotel! Highly recommend the Manhattan Club!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for NYC Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tennisplayerbbb
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in a very nice large, studio unit on the 19th floor of the Manhattan Club. There was daily maid service, daily coffee refills in the room, and daily popcorn which was a treat. In a studio, there is a $15 daily fee for maid and concierge service, (and in a one bedroom there is a $25 daily fee) which can't be eliminated except for a $45 credit if you take a timeshare presentation. However, you also get complimentary coffee and cookies from noon to four in the 26th floor lounge. The staff is super nice and helpful. The location is unbeatable, walking distance to Times Square, Fifth Ave, etc., and the subway is one block away. In fact we took the subway and the M60 bus from Astoria to Laguardia and it took about an hour from the Manhattan Club. We took CitysightsNY tours which the concierge booked for us ( You can save $5 if you book it yourself on line.). It was a two day hop on, hop off tour bus that took us all around downtown Manhattan, uptown, Brooklyn, night touring, cruising on the harbor to the Statue of Liberty and other sites, and even gave us a museum to see on the uptown tour. The guides seemed knowledgable and friendly. We would not hesitate to return to the Manhattan Club. I had one minor complaint about a drape that didn't close properly, and it was repaired immediately. The unit has a half refrig., a microwave, and even a dishwasher. It was an excellent vacation. NYC was clean, and the walking areas were a real treat. Central Park is two blocks away, and again, a treat to stroll in.

Reviews.Title: “The Manhattan Club, NYC”
Reviews.Author: BraveTraveler
Reviews.Content: This accomodation was clean, friendly and conveniently located. We are great walkers and did a ton of walking right from the front door. Great location to Central Park and short walk to Time Square. It was far enough away from the hussle and bussle of Time Square but it only took a few minutes to be in the middle of it. Our room faced the courtyard but could still see the street from our window. The windows are single pane so it was a bit loud. But the traffic was not bad so it was ok. Housekeeping was excellent but they need to be a bit more quiet with slamming doors. We were early risers but felt for those who were hoping to sleep in. Beds very comfortable. We were in a studio and only missed a toaster. But that might be due to fire regulations. Elevators are REALLY slow so don't hesitate to use the service elevator. No biggy though. Blue Line hop on - hop off is right around the corner. It was well worth the money. We took a two day pass and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!! It's close to all my favorite places.”
Reviews.Author: Carol W
Reviews.Content: What sold me on the Manhattan Club is the location. Besides being close to Times Square and Central Park, it's close to the Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Carnegie Hall, the theater district and some great restaurants. It has a very nice and spacious lounge, a gym and a free business center with ample computers. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The bathrobes add an extra touch. The staff is very courteous. On the con side the elevators are extremely slow and the lobby could use a makeover. Overall, I really enjoy staying at the Manhattan Club and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The location is great. Near Central Park, Carnegie Hall, Columbus Circle and Times Square”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: located on 56th and 7th, it's in the center of Manhattan. Easily assessable to everything by subway, bus or taxi. The location is the best thing I can say about it. Here are the pros: Location, room size, gym, free business center, nice staff, comfy mattresses and free wi-fi. If you are lucky enough to get room 2511, then it's worth the following cons. But few ever get this large updated room with an incredible view. Here are the cons: the wi-fi is weak and disconnects constantly. The elevators are very slow. There are 'secret' service elevators that I discovered, but they are also slow. The rooms need to be modernized. The decor is traditional and of not very high quality. The marble is from the 70's (it seems) and really ugly. The oversized stuffed leather chairs and sofa in the lobby make me cringe, they are so terrible. The sales staff calls too much to invite you to come down, but after you tell them you are not interested a couple of times, they stop. The shower heads don't produce a steady stream of water. I had two bathrooms and they both were bad. If you need to be in this area, you can do worse. But if you just want to experience Manhattan head downtown. Greenwich Village, Soho, Tribecca, Little Italy, China Town are all vibrant, charming, and unique.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay central location 4 star accommodation”
Reviews.Author: BonitaNaples
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay central location 4 star accomation we had the junior suite which more then enough space for us two, elevators very slow was the only problem we had will go back. Beware they charge why too much for breakfast $40 for 2 dont think so not for what you get

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: alex robert c
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club: I stayed with my friend-owner for the US Open and was greatly dassapointed. The room is big but furnished poorly, old spotted sofa, leaking aircondition from the ceiling, the toilet is not for a 'big' person. Staff is half-friendly. Elevators are just terrible, over slow, wait up to 15 min. There are additonal elevators offered to guests: trashed, dirty, and smell... due to no airconditioning at that area. The only positive is location and roomy space. But for the same price of ~$400-500 Hilton is much better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, the rest is average”
Reviews.Author: karensc0tt
Reviews.Content: We used rci points to stay here and not sure I would pay to go back - was all ok just not amazing. Our room had no natural daylight which made you feel like you were sleeping in a dungeon! Made it really hard to wake up. Service from staff was ok but not that friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect NYC Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Healthcoach1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Manhattan Club was nothing short of perfect! From the staff that greeted us upon our arrival, to the bellman, the concierge and the housekeeping staff, they did everything possible for us. Our room was a Jr. Suite and it was clean, comfortable and was well supplied. We really could not have asked for more in the heart of NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: cjnd2002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for an extended weekend and we exchanged in through Bluegreen (our timeshare) and were so lucky we did. The place is great! The first night we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite. It had a king sized bed in the bedroom and two great bathrooms; how nice to get ready at the same time in the morning - one in each bathroom! The second night we were in a smaller 1 bedroom and it had a queen sized bed in it and only one bathroom, which was fine for the two of us. (I should note that the reason we were in different rooms each night was because I booked it late and these were cancellations and all that was available - we had no issue with switching rooms). Each room had free wi-fi capabilities and we really appreciated that. We would recommend The Manhattan Club in a heartbeat! It's close to Central Park and plenty of restaurants. The front desk staff was courteous and amiable. One thing I would tell anyone staying at TMC is to be aware that the breakfast available in the Lounge is not free. It's $14.99 and charged to your room account. If you don't want to spend that $$, it's not a big issue when there are plenty of restaurants in the area that you can get breakfast for less at.

Reviews.Title: “A great exchange in New York - would definitely request again!”
Reviews.Author: The_Bear_Brigade
Reviews.Content: A very convenient location for Times Square and all Midtown destinations and less than one block away from the subway. We had a one bedroom suite which was just right for our family of four. The walls however seemed quite thin (or we just happened to have very loud neighbours) as we could clearly hear what was being said next door on a couple of occasions. Yes, there was a $25 a day hospitality charge, however there was free Internet, coffee, tea and popcorn was replenished daily and if you were around, free hot drinks and cookies in the member's lounge in the afternoon. Before arriving we received at least four invitations to the RCI presentation which we duly ignored. On site we received one written invitation and one call about this. We declined and were left to enjoy the rest of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, horrible accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Italy4X
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family weekend. The shower didn't work, the air conditioning was very noisy, the walls were paper-thin. The elevators were super slow. Only two of the 4 seemed to be working most of the time. The pull out couch was incredibly uncomfortable. It is my understanding that some of the rooms had been redone. Apparently on the 12th floor, this was not done. Location was great, walked everywhere, took in a show - Book of Mormon - fabulous!!! There are so many other choices of places to stay in NYC, go elsewhere. the

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a Theatre, Shopping, Central Park Weekend”
Reviews.Author: SGTrvlr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Manhattan Club for a girls' weekend. We went for shopping and theatre, and this place is a great stay for both. It's within walking distance of Central Park, theatres, and 5th Avenue. It was surprisingly quiet, the suites were spacious, and 5 women were surprisingly comfortable in a one-bedroom suite. I even found the other residents friendly and helpful. Nice bar/restaurant on a top floor.

Reviews.Title: “Exact opposite of previous poster...no problems here”
Reviews.Author: jas044
Reviews.Content: We also took advantage of the Living Social deal, which, if you add up the regular cost of the room and the gift card we received, saved us about $160. Yes, the tax wasn't included but it was a relatively minor inconvenience. Ours was the opposite experience of the previous poster. We were able to check in at 12:30, our executive junior suite (22nd floor) was quite nice and we had no problems with staff or the whole timeshare element. When making the actual reservation (both Living Social and Manhattan Club do have you jumping through a few hoops), we specified that we weren't interested in the timeshare chat and were weren't bothered once. I have heard that the Metropolitan Suites on the second floor were less impressive. The location was perfect for our needs...within a few blocks of the Central Park Zoo and MOMA...and the N & R subway line was a block up, as was a delicious dinner at Trattoria Dell'Arte.

Reviews.Title: “The Manhattan Club: The Good and the .....”
Reviews.Author: MBinBC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the MC for two weeks (July 9 - 23, 2011) and had the opportunity to stay in two of different suites. Using out Hilton points (affiliated with RCI) we felt lucky to get the place for two weeks as there are limited places to stay in Manhattan. Overall, our experience was a very good one. As many other reviewers have mentioned the location is fantastic. We were minutes, by foot, away from Columbus Circle, Central Park, and Broadway. A five minute walk would get you to Times Square and there is a Subway station less than a minute walk away. For you coffee drinkers just remember right, and right again and you will be at a Starbucks in seconds when you exit the MC's main doors. We found the housecleaning staff to be friendly and non-obtrusive. Our rooms were always clean and replenished. We found the housecleaning staff to be extremely pleasant and welcoming, they were also willing to help us if we were waiting for the elevator by offering the service elevator (we did not find the elevators to be particularly slow or inefficient other than the check out/in days). Let me preface the next part of the review by saying we stayed in two different types of rooms which offered two different experiences. The first week we stayed on the 16th floor overlooking the Wellington Hotel. The room was excellent, it was spacious, well planned and came with the usual amenities plus a dishwasher. We thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I believe most RCI/experinced travelers would be satisfied with this type of room. Our second week we stayed on the second floor. More about that in a minute but first a little about our experience with the front desk staff. When we arrived we were told we would have the same room for both weeks. I recall thinking that we really had lucked out. There is no question in mine or my wife's mind that this information was communicated to us so on the following Saturday when we got our check-out notice, I at first ignored it thinking 'it's Saturday, they just throw them under every door'. Nevertheless, I had a niggling feeling that this was not the case. We had an appointment scheduled for nine that morning. At 8:30 am I called down to the desk to make certain we were to stay in the same room and was told that we were to vacate by 11:00 am and relocate to a room on the second floor. It was very frustrating, especially since we had to cancel our 9am appointment and get packing. This inconvenience in itself was not the end of the world however the non-caring, non-helpful attitude of the front desk staff did not help. We had little to do with the front desk during our stay but if this scenario was an indication of how they deal with clients I would suggest they take some lessons from the cleaning staff who seem to have grasped the culture of hospitality. Now to the rooms on the second floor. They are clean and but poorly designed. There is only one bed side table even though there is room for two. The view is of a brick wall and in our case at least, a massive air-conditioning unit. For the life of us, we could not figure out the rationale behind the cups, plates and cutlery -- they were disposable plastic (the type you would get at KFC). The cups were pathetic- they reminded me of a child's play set (we re-used our paper Starbuck cups). Having said that, the room was okay and if we had not been on the 16th floor we would have perhaps been more satisfied with out room on the second (my wife disagrees with this point). We both agree though, that one should not be spending lots of time in the room other than to sleep and get ready for the day if you are staying in NYC, This was definitely the case with us and when we were in the suites we felt like we were in a safe, clean place that drowned out the hustle and bustle of the city regardless of the second floor room's shortcomings. Our stay in NYC was fantastic. Our stay at the Manhattan Club certainly complimented our incredible experience. I would recommend a stay at the MC but be aware the second floor suites are not ideal and don't expect an empathetic front desk staff versed in hospitality fundamentals to look after your concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Junior Executive Suite is the way to go!”
Reviews.Author: antgina
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the city overnight for dinner & a show. Got a great deal to The Manhattan Club through Bloomspot.com (great deals). Pulling up, the valet took our car & offered us help with the bags. Check in was a breeze. We requested a room next to our friends so had to wait until it was ready, no big deal, only 10 minutes. What a great surprise to see the size of the rooms for an NYC hotel!!!!! Nicely appointed, clean, well stocked with coffee, robes, etc. Wish the bathroom had a vanity instead of a pedastal sink - leave no where for your products when getting ready. Only complaint would be thin walls. Unless there were really loud guests! haha! I would go back in a heartbeat! Great location, right off of broadway and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: mississaugamom
Reviews.Content: The room in the Manhattan Club was a generous size compared to other rooms that I have stayed in. There was a double bed and a double pull out couch. The room had a kitchenette that was equipped with disposable dishes and utensils. The bathroom was very modern and clean with a huge walk in shower, the only thing it lacked was a bathtub, which did not bother us. This is a timeshare, which we were aware of. We were contacted about an info session but as soon as they realized it was two women without spouses they were not interested in talking to us. Come into this century Manhattan Club! The location is great very close to Central Park, subway and a easy walk to Times Square. An excellent stay and we will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: LucyDesi2010
Reviews.Content: Could not find a thing wrong. Clean, friendly and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: jairoabq
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Manhattan Club in July, 2011 with my wife and 2 kids (7 &10). The hotel itself was very nice, clean and the 1 bed suite was big enough for the four of us Pros: - Location. This hotel is within walking distance of many of the countless attractions in NYC. Broadway theaters, times square and central park are all around the corner. Also, there are several metro stations very close by. - Sleeper sofa: The quality of the sleeper sofa was superb! The unit had what seemed like a brand new sleeper sofa. It had a very comfortable, memory foam mattress (not one of those cheap coil mattresses you usually find in a sleeper sofa) - Size: The one bedroom unit was big enough for the four of us - huge by NYC standards. It had two full bathrooms, a big master bedroom, kitchen, table with 4 chairs and a living room area. More than enough - No pushy sales people. Once I told them I was not interested in taking their 'tour' (i.e. sales pitch) they did not bother me again CONS: Bathrooms: The bathrooms themselves were fine, but there was not enough room to put our things (toothpaste, contact lense cases, toothbrushes) by the sink. We kept knocking things down to the floor because there was just not enough room. Wallpaper seemed to be peeling a bit, but that was just a minor detail. Overall, this place was very good and we'd stay there again without any reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable NYC hotel near Central Park”
Reviews.Author: stephso
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club's location can't be beat. Two blocks from Central Park, one from Carnegie Hall, and close to the MoMA. The online deals right now are fantastic. We booked a junior suite with kitchenette for $250/night. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Bath and Body Works tolietries. Free wifi. The only disappointment is that the living area of the suite is not actually separate from the bedroom. It's small for a jr suite, but the more important part is not having a door to separate the two rooms. Thankfully this wasn't a big deal for us. Valet parking is $28; standard for NYC. Overall very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Second time at the Manhattan Club”
Reviews.Author: Yordy
Reviews.Content: We had been there in Nov 2008 and had loved it, so returned for a 1 week stay and had an almost corner unit in the 18th floor, wonderful view: broadway, central park, skyline...The most beautiful thing at the Manhattan Club is that you can feel at home, the 1 bedroom unit is roomy: living room (with sofabed), kitchenette, 2 bathrooms... a luxury in New York! The top floor lobby with coffee, the, cookies is nice and relaxing after a long day walking and visiting the big apple. The location can't be better, in the middle of everything but quieter than Time Square, walking distance to Lincoln Centre, and most of the museums. Internet wifi free in the rooms and office available at the top floor with computers and printers free of charge. We have spent 3 weeks there and would love to return!

Reviews.Title: “Things are looking up!”
Reviews.Author: Cabana-Boy-and-Girl
Reviews.Content: We stay here several times a year and I must mention that as time goes on the staff and management seem to be getting things back under control since the renovations have been completed. For a couple of years it was sketchy at best. Getting a reservation was a hassle, the place was getting run down around the heels, and it seemed to lack the sparkle it once had. Things are looking up. Each trip seems better than the last.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Club-NYC”
Reviews.Author: Abe64
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club timeshare in NYC is unlike any timeshare we've stayed at. It is more like a studio apartment. It's half a block from Broadway, several blocks from Central Park, walking distance to Times Square. It's a great place to stay for a visit to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: ewadesmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect place to retreat after a long day of sightseeing. It was very spacious (very uncommon in NYC) for our family of 3. The room(s) were clean and the staff was excellent! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at Manhattan Club”
Reviews.Author: crissyrod
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a trial ownership and decided to use one of the nights to be able to be in the city for the fireworks for July 4th. We did arrive early because we had a meeting with the ownership program at noon. While our room was of course not ready that early we were able to enjoy snacks in the lounge upstairs. Our room was beautiful and it was quiet even though we were closer to the elevator. Another awesome experience and everyone at the Club was very kind. We have several more nights left and we are anxious to use them. Central Park is close by for a romantic carriage ride. Several excellent restaurants are nearby as well.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hulagirl86
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my family of four. Master bedroom and bathroom were very nice. Sofa bed in living area was uncomfortable and squeaked with every move. Elevators were very slow. Bellman was very friendly and helpful, especially in getting us cabs. It was a very convenient place to stay near everything...Times Square, Broadway shows, shopping, Central Park!

Reviews.Title: “Average Room”
Reviews.Author: robynzechel
Reviews.Content: The room was snug as there were 4 of us in it. The hotel was average, they put us in a rather small room considering we were contemplating buying a time share with them, they didnt treat us as well as I would have expected considering. It is nice and close to central park which was great. It was an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable weekend in great location”
Reviews.Author: JCD258
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this timeshare/hotel for a long weekend and it was very nice. The room was large for a hotel room in Manhattan and well priced for the location. The staff was friendly and helpful. They called and offered the timeshare presentation, but it did not meet our schedule. They accepted this and did not call again. The bell staff was helpful. The concierge staff were all great with advice on transportation, directions and arranging meal reservations. The location was perfect a couple of blocks from Central Park, within view of Carnegie Hall, and easy walking distance to the MOMA and many other locations. We visited as part of a 20th anniversary trip and the ride through the park, and other opportunities close by made the trip. The only issue was a plumbing problem in the middle of the night, and the desk had an engineer to the room to fix it in minutes, and had it mostly cleaned up. The next day after housekeeping had been in the room you could not tell there had been an issue. When it was time to leave they arranged for a car service to transport us to the cruise terminal for the amount estimated for a city taxi. I would certainly stay at this location again!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Luvem2
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect! Close to the subway, within walking distance of Central Park, Times Square, restaurants, shopping, and Starbucks! The rooms were large (living, kitchen, 2 bathrooms, and bedroom. Housekeeping was 5 star!! The Concierge Service was outstanding and so very helpful!! Loved our trip to New York and the Manhattan Club made it perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KO1300
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping, theatre and site seeing - third time and we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Mislead on a Suite”
Reviews.Author: GITProfessor
Reviews.Content: Not my first visit to NYC but it was for my two friends who were with me. This was a trip to celebrate our each turning 60 this year. When I made the reservation I was excited to have a suite and the pictures on the website certainly showed enough space for three adult women. You can imagine our surprise when we walked in to a standard sized hotel room. The only thing that made it a suite was the couch that made into a bed (another bed would have worked instead of making this each night) and the micro kitchenette. We were cramped and barely had room for our clothes let alone the souvenirs we bought! Staff at the desk were not overly helpful, the doormen and maid staff however were very friendly and helpful. Will likely go back to the city, don't think we'll stay here again though.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and spacious unit”
Reviews.Author: timbuk2Ontario
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Manhattan Club during the Easter weekend. We had a one bdroom unit and it's the most spacious accomodation we ever had in NYC. The unit is kept very clean but the furnishings need updated. Prior to arrival, we had asked for an updated unit and was told my request was noted. At check in (a cool reception), we were told the unit was an updated unit. The unit was located right in front of the elevator but it turned out there was no issue with noise at all. But the unit was definitely not one of the updated unit. The fabric on the sofa was worn away and the door to the dishwasher look like it was falling off. We didn't use the dishwasher so we couldn't tell if it works. Aside from that, everything was fine- bed was comfortable and the unit was quiet though not much of a view. The valet parking rate at $28 per 24 hours was very reasonable compared with the lots nearby. Overall, it was a good stay though the service level could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: willykim
Reviews.Content: Our first time to NY. Location Location Location -walking distance to almost everything and close to the subway for everything else. Room size is great for two, had an inside room so there is no view. $25 a night for housekeeping was a bit much but it saved tipping every time you turned around. Nice to come back to the room and have it cleaned every day. Didn't use the partial kitchen much but it was nice to have a microwave and small fridge. Concierge service was very helpful with directions, tickets for shows etc. I would pass on the timeshare presentation, just not the way to kill 1 1/2 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: britondabayou
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during April. We booked the junior suite as there we had our three teenage children with us. This hotel is situated on the corner of west 56 and 7th avenue. We could see times square from the corner and it was a easily walkable distance. We didnt use the subway at all, so i cant say if it was convenient or not. Not a whole lot of amenities at the hotel, a gym and a lounge - bar opens at 4.30 pm. We paid $399 a night without tax, and this was very good value for money considering new york rooms are small and we would have had to book two rooms in other hotels. I would have given a better review if 1. The staff were friendlier - the reception desk and concierge were particularly frosty. We arrived at 11 and were told we couldnt get an early check in and to come back at 4pm. We actually arrived at about 3.50pm and were told a room wasnt ready and to take a seat and wait. The lobby is small with not much furniture . At 4.35 pm, we went to check again and were told yes the room had been ready since 4pm. They had not bothered to inform us of this.. We had waited sitting on the floor for 35 minutes. The manager later apologised. 2. We were not informed that there was a charge for the rollaway bed ($25), not that it mattered particularly to us, but it would have been nice to have known in advance. 3. They switched the airconditioning off - gave a garbled excuse, but did provide us with a fan. WE were hot and we all had broken nights sleep because of it. 4. We all got soaked on one occasion and there was no laundry service. we had wet clothes draped everywhere. Jason, the bellboy of chinese origin was the only friendly person there. He always greeted us with a smile, and nothing was too much for him. So to summarise, I feel that the Manhatten Club suites could have been a great stay IF the staff and management were more helpful and sensitive to their guests comfort.

Reviews.Title: “never even made it”
Reviews.Author: J_Jforever
Reviews.Content: Had a message on my home answering machinel from Bridget at The Manhattan Cub. She said that we had entered a drawing and even though she didn't quite have all the results, she did have great news for us and a wonderful offer. Well who could resists this, so of course I called her back. Bridget did get on the phone and then she proceeded to ask questions about our employment, income and assets. After a few minutes she came back and said since our income and assets did not meet their requirements, they would keep us in their files. Okay, I told her, but did we win anything? She said no, and did not mean to mislead us. Okay, then what is the great news and offer you had for us? Then she said nothing at this time and was sorry for bothering us. So basically her message was just a ploy to get us to buy into this vacation sharing place. Fool me once, and once only, but shame on you Manhattan Club, you never even offered me a chance to look at your place. Tavelers beware of places that promote this type of behavior and business.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but thin walls in our room... (noisy neighbors)”
Reviews.Author: EveyBl
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club has some great things going for it (location, room size), but it also some issues that should be addressed. We booked two nights at the Club via Points with our timeshare and had hoped to extend the stay for one night with cash. Well, that was apparently impossible to do. Though the front desk could confirm that empty rooms were available, they redirected us to the marketing department. At the marketing department, we were told to wait until the morning of checkout and then inquire with the front desk. Well, I certainly didn't want to cancel our reservations elsewhere and hope that the Manhattan Club actually had a room... only to be stuck with no place to sleep on our final night in NYC. I still have NO IDEA how to make a reservation to extend a stay with cash nights at this facility! As a result, we ended up moving to the Hilton Club for our last night in NYC. We had initially considered adding ownership at TMC to our other timeshare ownerships, but with it being so difficult to extend stays with cash (which we frequently do elsewhere), we have decided against this. Extension issues aside, our room at the Manhattan Club was very comfortable during the day. It was in great condition, clean, and laid out well. Unfortunately, though, we had very LOUD neighbors who returned to their room both nights at 2:30am and then proceeded to yell back and forth to each other. This would continue until about 6am each morning as they each showered (yelling to each other the whole time), watched TV at top volume, yelled to each other over the shows, and finally would call people on the phone. I can only guess they had relatives or friends who lived on the other side of the world since they were phoning at these times. We could hear EVERY word they said through the walls. I finally called security at about 4:30am the second morning and asked that someone come up and tell the neighbors to quiet down. The lack of sleep really did affect our ability to enjoy our time in NYC. It was a great relief when we heard the knock on the door, the guard ask them to quiet down, and then the couple discuss how awful it was that we had called and reported them. Yep, we heard it ALL. But, then they finally did give us some peace. All in all, we do plan to return to TMC when we travel to NYC in the future... but next time, we will probably bring along some of those earplugs for soundproof sleeping!

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the opportunity if you get it!”
Reviews.Author: Mackasx2
Reviews.Content: In New York rooms are generally small because real estate it so expensive. So imagine our surprise and pleasure when we were fortunate enought to get a timeshare exchange. at the Manhattan Club, regardless of the size of the room. Then imagine our delight when we found our one bedroom apartment had a sofa bed which made it a 4 person accommodation so had two bathrooms. As there was only the 2 of us this meant we had a bathroom each!. We had a kitchenette with microwave, coffee maker, firdge and dishwasher plus our rooms were serviced dail. We also had access to gym, large louge with bar which operated form 4.30pm and business centre where printing of documents was free. Also free interent wifi throughout the building. There are more positives I could add from our perspective but realise that I am now prejudiced! Great value, great service and I would go back anyday.

Reviews.Title: “RCI members from South Africa”
Reviews.Author: GDTravelsMargateRSA
Reviews.Content: The Manhannten Club must go down as one of the best RCI resorts and we recommend anyone visiting NYC to stay at the Club. A truly great stay

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Centralized Location”
Reviews.Author: dalejnut
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from Central park, about 8 blocks to Time Square, two blocks from Fifth Ave. Can't ask for much more. Broadway on one side and 7th Ave on the other. The Manhatten Club is very nice and clean. Check-in took less than five minutes. The Concierge, Debra and Serge, were very helpful and knowledgeable. Note that any Broadway tickets that they get for you will have an additional $25 added to each ticket. Its cheaper to get your own tickets as the box offices aren't really that far away. The bed and pillows are very soft and comfortable. Love having the two bathrooms. Our view from 1402 was of a brick wall but I wasn't there to look out my window. I found that the continential breakfast, although very good, was over priced for the limited selection. $14.99/person. I recommend the Downtown bus tour at $44/person but if you get the Chinese lady, you may not understand her very well and may not get the full benefit of the tour. The carriage ride around Central Park wasn't required. We could have walked it ourselves in about two hours vice the hour that we did for $80. Our taxi to the airport took about an hour (Friday at 11:00am) and cost $43.

Reviews.Title: “I was given a room in the 'basement' (really the second floor) however I could not tell if it was day or night”
Reviews.Author: busytravelerr
Reviews.Content: Wow - I have traveled for business for 40 years and I have never been so insignificant as I am at the Manhattan Club. I must admit that it is a timeshare - not a hotel however the level of service is minimal at best. 1. I tried to contact the hotel on a Sunday to find out the check in time - all possible phone #s were not available until 9-5 Monday-to Friday - an email was sent to state a 4 PM check in 2. At Check-in @ 3:30 - no rooms were available til 4 PM - most hospitable hotels have some flexibility - very limited customer focus 3. The room was a dungeon, the room in the 'basement' (really the second floor) was so dark at 4 PM I could not tell if it was day or night. It was the same situation the next morning at 8 AM, I could not tell if it was day or night. Imaging my surprise when I went out the front door and I needed sunglasses. I can go on - I think you have the picture You can find much better accomodation on travel zoo dot com to enjoy New York City

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious rooms, will come again”
Reviews.Author: maiko1
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom suite we stayed is was so spacious - as a former Manhattanite - I kept thinking that it would be a nice apartment to live in. Both bathrooms were also spacious - my only complaint there is that they don't have fans! I also wish check in is a little earlier. They have reasonable valet parking but there is also plenty of free parking on the street on Sundays. Free wifi but I could never connect - I just used the cable in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: auduende
Reviews.Content: I have to say, after having read some reviews, mostly on this site, I was very nervous about staying in this hotel. The reviews varied widely between "wonderful" and "horrible" with very few in between, so I thought I'd take the time to submit my own review. We booked 2 rooms over the President's Day weekend for all 5 of us (3 adults, 2 small children). Initially there was a SNAFU over the rooms, but after a while, things got worked out and they gave us adjoining rooms (we did have to pay $75 extra). Contrary to what some people have said, we thought the rooms were rather spacious as far as NYC rooms are concerned. We even had a king sized bed, which I wasn't expecting but was very glad to have. The kitchenette was very convenient as well as the 2 full bathrooms. There was plenty of room to spread out. The elevators: yes, they were slow at times, but not so much that had us waiting forever. In fact, they run a separate set of elevators around the corner, so if the main ones were busy we could always catch those. Like all the other reviewers, I agree that you just can't beat the location. You're close to Central Park south and just blocks away from Times Square. Everything was so convenient. They also have a mini grocery store nearby as well. The staff were very nice, the lady at the concierge desk was helpful and answered all our questions. The doormen always had a smile. Never encountered anyone who was rude. It isn't the Ritz Carlton, so as long as you know that going in, you'll be happy. It isn't a rundown hotel either. I just think people might be expecting way too much. It was clean and nice looking, superbly located, and met our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Brilliant Location in Heart of Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Jvalant
Reviews.Content: Hotels don't come cheap in Manhattan for sure and this one is no exception. But everything about the hotel was great - the service, the staff but above all the location. The suite was well furnished with a small kitchenette including a microwave, coffee maker, fridge and the rooms included a TV and a DVD player could be called for. No complaints - definitely worth staying in .

Reviews.Title: “Great base for NYC”
Reviews.Author: Riveroak
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before going here on timeshare exchange. We found the Manhattan Club to be great. It was perfect location in midtown Manhattan in walking distance to many attractions and very convenient to subways. The staff was polite and helpful. Our rooms were clean, nicely appointed and quiet. We enjoyed our stay greatly and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girl's Weekend”
Reviews.Author: emscot20
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Manhattan Club, we were treated wonderfully. From the valet, to the reception representativie, to the bellhops, to the housekeeping staff; everyone went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. I have to admit that from the other reviews on here, I was a little worried about booking. However, all I kept saying while I was there, was "what customer service"! Not to admit, the hotel itself is really nice. Our room was tastefully decorated and the bathrooms are beautiful!!!! You will not think that you are in a NYC hotel when you are here. I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. It has a great location and the staff really goes out of their way to help their guests and to accomodate their every need.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: dotters
Reviews.Content: Quite a small room with no view, but a terrific location. We were surrounded by the best of NY. Bed was quite comfortable, but the couch for our teenager wasn't the best. Otherwise, would stay again, but in a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AmesnBru
