Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple traveled to NY for a quick getaway and used a Living Social (dot com) coupon for a stay at this hotel. It was clean, fresh and we LOVED the location!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T WAIST YOUR TIME AND MONEY”
Reviews.Author: simosito2002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this club last year from 7/2-7/5/10.the same thing happened to us we went with my parents and the room was very small..we didn't know that we cant cook their so we used the rice cooker in the room the room the next day when we came back to our room the rice cooker was missing they took it with out our permission they should have given us the note regards that,, that we shouldn't use the rice cooker not take it without out any notice..The worse part was they damage my car my beautiful new car .the driver who took my car to park it in the parking that was in front of hotel damaged my car.when i told them about that they said it was their before .i know it wasn't I'm not lying they are just bunch of lairs that they feed their stomach with lies.my new car didn't had any scratch...I will never go there and I suggest you that don't go their if you go don't let them park your car for you they are lazy and don't know how to drive a car.they charge us $120 for the car I wish we didn't give them the money.But they are smart they don't give you your car unless you paid the parking first....DON'T WAIST YOUR TIME AND MONEY

Reviews.Title: “Owner advice--holding on telephone for 45 minutes--forget service!!”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryExplorer
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review while holding on two telephones for "owner services," which has not answered either line for 45 minutes. As I hold, I am finding more and more fault with our stays--the front desk was never that helpful, and much as we love the two bathrooms with our one-bedroom suite, waiting endlessly for the elevator was exhausting...The maintenance fees about doubled over the six or so years that we have owned, and the automatic billing hits us ever earlier--i.e., August for the next January. To reserve one's floating week, one must pay at the reservation date, which can be almost a year in advance of the date that fees are actually due. We have noticed management selling the rooms via Hotels.com, etc., and wonder if the owners are being squeezed out. Of course, management reserves the right to buy out a timeshare seller if it considers the price too low, so sale prices do not reflect owners true lack of regard for the place...My conclusion: better to pay for a real hotel, with up-front charges and pay-dates, and probably a discount for paying early.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: crissyrod
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews online prior to our trip and were not sure we wanted to come. We went to NYC for New Year's Eve, so we wanted it to be nice. People said the rooms were dingy, etc. When we checked in, everyone was friendly and we were taken care of quickly. We had book 5 days and 4 nights, they had us for 4 days and 3 nights once we presented our confirmation, she adjusted it immediately, no questions asked. Very nice. The club was clean and our room was great. We were on 24th floor and we were very pleased with it. Housekeeping was prompt and we never saw them, they did not impose at all on us. Maybe some people just expect to much, we have stayed many places in NYC and this was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect NYC hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: ClarkL13
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Manhattan Club with my family, which included my 2 year old, over Thanksgiving for the Macy's Parade. Every aspect of our reservation and stay was incredibly easy. The Manhattan Club staff was so helpful when we booked our room last spring, we knew we needed to book early because of the parade, and they even gave us a room overlooking the parade route - so we didn't even have to leave our room to watch the parade! Our room was huge (a one bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms and a living room!), and completely affordable. The entire suite was very clean and the bathrooms were spotless. The beds were comfortable and all the linens were top-notch. My family and I cannot wait to return to New York City again and stay in this fabulous hotel...especially since we were able to walk everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing Stay @ TMC”
Reviews.Author: cnorris34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at TMC from 12/3-12/5/10. My parents had never been to NYC city, so we wanted to offer the trip to be a positive experience for them. When we checked into TMC- the room was not ready until 4:05PM and once we arrived at room they place all 4 of us in a metro suite which had a pull out sofa and king size bed that were 1 foot apart and very little room to move throughout the room together. We were promised a divided area between sleeping arrangements for privacy. When I asked to be moved- they avised me that they were completely full and could not accomadate. Once we resided to bed- we pulled out sleeper sofa to find that it was broken and would not support mattress. I insisted to the from desk asst manager that we needed to be moved or bed repaired (at 1AM) and they decided to call repair person to look at sofa bed. Finally at 1:45AM another assistance manager called us to desk and placed us in another suite. Coffee pot in room was broken and repair person came to room after 2 hrs to bring alternate pot and when he hooked up coffee maker- he left the heater on. If we had not been there to see that- the room may have caught fire and our group blamed for damages. Rooms are dirty and hotel arrangements are sub-par. Soda and smack machine on 26th floor remained 90% empty all weekend. I am so glad that we did not purchase timeshare with the Manhatten club- they are far from a 5 star resort in my opionion. If they did offer refunds (which they don't, mainly because they would go out of buiness if they did)... I would certainly ask for my money back. Lesson learned........ DO NOT BOOK WITH THE MANHATTEN CLUB.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Club won't refund prepaid reservation”
Reviews.Author: pafarmer79
Reviews.Content: In Oct made reservations for 2 nights at the Manhattan Club for this January. Paid in advance. I asked the lady on the phone to make sure we could cancel. I just tried to cancel and they "offer" a policy of no cancellations. I know what they're offering and I don't like the smell of it. Am pursuing other means to get my money back. Don't book here if required to pay up front.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in the city”
Reviews.Author: sofia90210
Reviews.Content: We travel to Manhattan on a yearly basis and bought a timeshare at the Manhattan Club three years ago. With two teenaged daughters, it's tough to find something as spacious as the suites at the Manhattan Club that are not exorbitantly expensive, so we purchased there. The service is excellent, and the reservations a breeze when we go through our salesperson, Arnie. Some of the rooms have not been renovated, but he always manages to put us in an updated room. We are very pleased with our ownership there, and the location can't be beat. It's three blocks from Central Park and within a block of Broadway theatres and Fifth Avenue shopping. Subways are right on the corner, and therefore Soho and Chinatown are 5 minutes away by train. We have recommended numerous friends who have also purchased there. It's a great value but Manhattan is not inexpensive. The concierge, Carmi, is also the best! He got us discounted tickets for Million Dollar Quartet on a Saturday night for less than $100 each, fourth row center orchestra! We also got into the Palm, which was completely booked up, through him.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great, central location for a visit to NYC”
Reviews.Author: bostonterrier
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend stay at the Manhattan Club. It was very nice--I stayed in a one bedroom suite, with one bedroom, a living room/dining room/kitchenette combo with a sleeper sofa and two full bathrooms. The suite we had was clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were really spacious, and we had plenty of clean towels. The location was great...within easy walking distance to the seventh avenue express subway train for easy access to downtown. The Manhattan Club doesn't have a restaurant, but there are lots of great restaurants nearby, including Serafina, Carnegie Deli and Banash. There's also a Starbucks right around the corner. Rockefeller Center, 5th Avenue shopping and MOMA are within walking distance. We did not take advantage of the concierge, but we did use the bag check service twice, which was no problem at all. All in all, a very good experience. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in NYC”
Reviews.Author: stewnet
Reviews.Content: Ignore all the negative comments - you will enjoy your stay. And to the management - do not listen to complainers that say your staff is rude - absolutely everyone of the staff was quite the opposite. . Check in was easy and fast as was check out. Concierge was friendly and helpful. Bellmen were nice, friendly and helpful. Did they have their hand out for a tip as one poster wrote?? Absolutely not! But did we tip? Of course - that is what you do in a hotel!! Elevators - not sure what some are referring to, but we never waited an excessive amount of time for an elevator. Not even once. It is a non issue. Location - perfect- close to everything. A few blocks from Times Square and close to the Theatre District. Room - Not large, but by NYC standards the room was spacious and good value for the money. (we booked an RCI extra vacation and payed about $1160.00 Cdn for three nights.). We were three sisters sharing a studio, the bed was comfortable, my sister slept on the couch without pulling it out, so not sure what the sofa bed was like, but the couch was fine. The room were clean (no bed bugs and we had a public health nurse in our group who knows how to check), Washrooms were nice - not luxurious but clean, updated. Loved having the small kitchenette - enjoyed cereal and coffee in our room for breakfast and wine and cheese for snacks. I will definitely stay here for my next trip to NYC (which hopefully is soon)!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base for park, museums and city”
Reviews.Author: floatingworld_10
Reviews.Content: Two blocks down from Central Park, with spacious, well-maintained suites, Manhattan Club was a great base from which to explore New York. Our suite comprised a double room and bathroom and living room with sofa bed, cooking facilities and a second bathroom. Decoration is somewhat bland and we had to put a duvet on the sofa bed mattress to make it comfortable; otherwise the facilities were great and the staff were very helpful. Access to pcs in the business suite was useful and the free popcorn was good too!

Reviews.Title: “small timeshare hotel”
Reviews.Author: orientallady2010
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights through RCI exchange during the Christmas 2009. The room we got was extremely small compared with other timeshare property. I think it was even smaller than other standard hotel rooms that we stayed before in NYC. The location was excellent. We walked to Central Park in the Christmas day. They have a lounge on the 26th floor provides coffee and cookies. Very nice. Since this is a timeshare hotel, the salesmen or women were pretty aggresive. But I don't blame them. They did give us some meal vouchers for participating in their presentation One thing we were unhappy was the valet parking guy damaged our brand new ski rack but the Manhattan Club's management refuse to take responsibility. They claimed that the Ski Rack was not part of the car. The first day the car was parked in the gargage with a high clearance area but the next day someone move the car to the lower level of the gargage and did not pay attention to the ski rack that added a few inches to the car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelingolfers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week. We found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. the studio was clean and spacious enough for the two of us, and the location was excellent. There were many restaurants, activities, and attractions within walking distance. This was an RCI exchange and were told when we made our reservation that we were fortunate to get in. We booked several months in advance when the week became available, but it was worth planning ahead. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: cassie3375
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 young children and it was wonderful...spacious (HUGE for NYC) room with separate bedroom and kitchen! The location was extremely convenient to many restaurants, Times Square, and Central Park. Even though it's not cheap, it's definitely worth it compared to what you get for similar prices elsewhere. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't look at the bad reviews - look at this one!!!”
Reviews.Author: Betzyboo27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this apartment for one week commencing 02/10/10. Stayed in a one room apartment with my husband and 24 year old son. We read all the comments on this establishment and we were slightly concerned with what we read - any fears we had were quashed within 1 min of us arriving at reception. We were slightly early and our room wasn't quite ready. The lovely receptionists said that she could look for another apartment that was ready and did we have any requests - we simply stated that we would take the best that she could offer - she offered us a room with a view or a larger room without a view - we dicided that in new york you go outside to see the view and that we would benefit from a larger apartment. We were not disappointed - the extra space was brilliant - the room was to a high standard and was very clean - not having a view meant we had very little noise as we were away from the hussle of street life. The mini kitchen was well equipped with microwave, coffee maker - plates, mugs, cuttlery, glasses, bottle opener - even a dishwasher. There was also a daily supply of filtered coffee - decaf included and also pop corn. The fridge was a good size and had a freezer compartment - there were free ice machines on the 14th and 26th floors. As for the previous comments on the lifts - yes if you used them at peak times you had a wait - but there were alternative lifts available for use if required - the longest we waited was 5 mins. The location was excellent 5 mins walk from central park and the same to times square. Lots of eateries nearby - the local cafes were good for breakfast - the europa cafe was good for set menu breakfasts the dearest being $6. Check out was good too - we had to check out at 11am but didnt have to leave for airport until 2pm - we left our bags with concierge and we were issued with a ticket to uplift them later - we also still had use of the restroom and the lounge area. After checking out I had a query about my credit card - I was treated with the same level of service of a checked in guest and the reception staff were great. We would definitely use this accommodation again and can't believe the negative reviews that we have read.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for mid-town”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_in_Colorado
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights this trip and found this to be a very convenient location for the theater district, restaurants and the park. Having the use of small kitchen in the room is beneficial and the rooms are large enough to not feel cramped. There is a very good business center in the complex. The hop-on/hop-off buses will stop at the corner one block away if you have already gotten tickets.

Reviews.Title: “DONT BUY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gomers
Reviews.Content: This is a warning to anyone who is even thinking about buying at Manhattan Club...I bought from a family member who was suffered a family crisis and couldn't afford or use the property...BAD MISTAKE!!! They have oversold the property by leaps and bounds and it is IMPOSSIBLE to get time unless you call 9 MONTHS TO THE DAY you want to stay. That is ridiculous! The maintence fees are THROUGH THE ROOF!!! STAY AWAY STAY AWAY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: KaDo2606
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the Manhattan Club on Oct. 2 and stayed for one week in a junior suite. From one to five stars, I have to rate this hotel 4 1/2 stars. The personnel were very accomodating and a pleasure to speak to. From check-in to the concierage to check out I couldn't stress more how helpful and pleasant everyone was. The room was roomy and well furnished for a NYC hotel. The maid came in daily and made sure the room was clean. She furnished us with our decaf coffee packets daily which was great for the morning. The furnishings were not elegant, but they served their purpose for storing our clothing and accessories. We had a flat screen TV in the living room area which was great, but was not viewable from the bedroom area. It would have been nice to be able to watch television in bed before going to sleep. I found the kitchenette to be sufficient for snacking as there was a small refrigerator, microwave, sink and dishwasher. The bathroom had a stall shower, but no tub which I found odd as the room is very large. We were situated on the 22nd floor facing seventh ave. and there was very little noise unless a siren was passing by the building. But, that is the music of NYC, so it did not affect us at all. I utlized the exercise room a few times and found it sufficient for a decent workout as it contained treadmills, bikes, a universal, a benchpress machine and free weights in the form of dumbells. I was able to get a good sweat before I visited the fantastic nearby restaurants. The only complaint I have which caused me to knock a half star rating from perfect is the room temperature. You cannot control the room temperature, only the speed of the fan. If the temperature outside is cool the heat is on and the only thing you can do is open the windows about two inches to let in cool air. It got so warm that we had to request a fan which was promptly brought to our room. We complained about the temperature and it was explained that some guests were cold and they had to put the heat on. We heard the heat complaint from other people on the elevators. I'veheard complaints from others critiqueing this hotel about the elevators being slow. We did not experience that, however the hotel was not full. There were times we had to wait nearly five minutes for an elevator, but that did not affect us. Overall, I rate this hotel very high and recommend it to anyone who is looking for a very clean, comfortable hotel located in an outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: hpisles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manhattan Club Hotel for 5 days in September 2010. We found this hotel through our friend's timeshare but did not use the time share option since our friend wanted to use her timeshare week for something else. So we stayed at the Manhattan Club for $350-$375 per night which was comparable with the surrounding hotels in the area. Manhattan is not a cheap place to go so expect high hotel rates! Prior to going I received frequent emails and calls offering free dinners, free shows, reduce rates, etc if we would attend their 90 min timeshare presentation (this is a bit annoying). After finally figuaring our schedule we decided not to attend since there was so much to do in New York and our time was limited so we opt out of the presentation. Also their web site is a bit strange and ended up having to call customer service to reduce our stay by one night. I requested early check-in but it turned out none of the rooms were ready until 4:00 p.m. (wished they had told us that prior to going back/forth to the hotel trying to check in). All the staff was very helpful and friendly (expect for the intial staff we meet - we showed up at 9:00 a.m. after taken a red eye flight) and I guess they got tired of me asking if our room was ready. The rest of the staff was quite friendly and helpful. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with 2 bathrooms and flat screen tv in each room and sofabed in sitting room. This worked out exceedingly well since we had 4 adults and also had a rollaway (additional $25 per night) it worked out perfectly for our needs. Having a small kitchen with refigerator, microwave and coffemaker (with coffee) worked out perfectly. King-size bed was very comfortable and the rooms were large compared to what we previously gotten in New York. The only problem with the room was the air conditioner didn't work very well but we discovered if we pulled down all the curtians and turning on the air con full blast that the room would be a comfortable tempature when we returned in the evenings. In the mornings when it was cool and there was a breeze we opened the windows. We skipped the $14 all you can eat buffet breakfast and opted to get pastries at a corner street cart right outside ($2). Also plenty of coffee shops and delis nearby as well as resturants. Hotel was very clean and the bell staff was VERY friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean and nicely done. VERY Centrally located and bus and subway stations were close by. Time Square and Central Park was within walking distance. You couldn't ask for a better location since everything and everyplace was easy to get too / from here. We do plan on staying here again when we return to Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “good stay and location is everything but a tad pricey and noisy A/C”
Reviews.Author: bogelo
Reviews.Content: I had no problem from check in till check out. The room was a bit small for a suite (metropolitan suite) and the windows A/C was noisy as hell and smelly. We ended up opening the windows during our stay (luckily it wasnt that hot). I think the room is really pricey but I think for its price, this hotel is the cheapest room at the most strategic location. It was good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Came down from my resort at carriage...”
Reviews.Author: mackster101
Reviews.Content: Came down from my resort at carriage hills for 4days. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful checked bags in while we toured city by bus, great way to see sites then decide what to see. Room was small but clean and nicely done, air conditioning was not working. Room was located on 2nd floor where they take you in for the tour and try to hard sell you, when you show no interest they boot you right away answer pretty rude about it. Once that crap is done enjoy the free meal voucher for a hundred bucks and go out and enjoy the city. Location is excellent central park is close by and great for running, times swayed and broadway all within walking distance so for that alone stay is well worth it here. I would never buy here though so be prepared to get a hard sell throw that aside and enjoy NY

Reviews.Title: “Terrible deal for the club owners”
Reviews.Author: fibonacc
Reviews.Content: As one who bought into the Manhattan Club 2 years ago, I have to say that owners are treated very poor. We have never been able to book the nights we are "entitled" to. This is a typical bait and switch, ponzi scheme. THE ONLY WAY FOR ME TO BOOK is at least 9 months ahead and this doesn't work for me. TMC can care less about its owners, but love prospects....and their "new" money. The stuff is rude and aggressive. Biggest mistake I ever made, and now I cannot sell it on the secondary market as they require a primary position for sales. What a racket.... Has the NY Attorney General been contacted yet?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Awful Staff”
Reviews.Author: friendlybear
Reviews.Content: The location and room quality cannot be beaten, however the staff are surly, unhelpful and in short make you feel that they are doing you a favour by letting you stay there. We stayed at the Manhattan club as part of an RCi Timeshare exchange and were compelled to attend a sales presentation as part of the exchange. Once we made it clear that we had no interest in purchasing after being exposed to some high pressure selling by two individuals who would be more at home in a gangster movie, we were treated like parhias. We did however enjoy the $100 dinner voucher they had to give us for attending.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: 1norcalman
Reviews.Content: We traded our time share in Hawaii for a week at this time share in New York. Check-in was quick and easy with a friendly staff. Concierge was very helpful. Our suite on the 21st floor was "roomy" for New York standards with a small kitchenette, small living room/dining area, comfortable bedroom and clean bathroom. Cable TV is expansive with about 80 channels (though none in HD). Though in NYC, the room was quiet, and we had partial city views. The location is awesome. Walking distance to two subway stations, Central park, Times Square, and lots of shopping, restaurants, grocery stores (including Whole Foods). The maid service was excellent, and the room was cleaned thoroughly each day. There is an excellent gym on the top floor with universal machine, free weights, bikes, and cross trainers. And, a business center is available with several desk tops and a printer. The only downsides ... the elevators are VERY slow. At times we waited more than ten minutes to get an elevator. And, the only thing slower than the elevators is the Internet. It is complimentary, but honestly, it is as slow as dial-up much of the time. If you're planning on doing work while in NYC with your laptop, you will likely be very frustrated and wish you stayed elsewhere (and don't even think of looking at anything on YouTube ... it will lock up tighter than the vault at the nearby Bank of America). But if you just want to check email or a couple of website, it will likely be OK. Overall, we loved our stay here and will likely return.

Reviews.Title: “NEW YORK, NEW YORK”
Reviews.Author: screenname009
Reviews.Content: Having read some of your other reviews we were concerned about this week, but got there to find that we could not understand the critics. We are timeshare owners who have exchanged to various places and this was a very food one. We only had a studio but it slept 4 there was a large bed and sofa bed. The room was large and well furneshed, lots of wardrobe space which we were evan able to fit in the 3 suite cases we took. There was a half kitchen which was fine for those who do not want cook, which I avoid on holiday. There was a microwave and dishwasher. Tea, Coffee and popcorn was replenished each day. We have stayed in New York once before and this was a much better room both in size and furnishings. This hotel is close to Central Park, Times Sqare and Carnegie Hall. Also walking distance to the Naturnal History musum New York Zoo and the Guggenhiem Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while visiting New York”
Reviews.Author: JDBytheSeaBoston
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at The Manhattan Club for the first time on a Monday and Tuesday night. The whole family loved it and we had a great time. I was concerned given some of the past reviews, but was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We pulled up to the main entrance and were greeted by a very friendly doorman who valet parked our car and mentioned the still-great parking rate of $28/night (a real bargain in NYC). The bellman brought our bags inside and we were greeted by James at the front desk. There was no line at all and he checked us in quickly, could not have been more friendly or helpful, and made us feel very welcome. It was 3:00 and our room would not be ready until 4. We left our bags with the bellman and headed out for some shopping on 5th Ave. which is a very short walk. Our room was ready when we arrived. The elevators to the 25th floor were not a problem at all. Sometimes there was a short wait, but other hotels have been much longer -- try the elevators at the Marriott in Times Square, what a nightmare. We had a 1-bedroom suite with a sofabed in the LR, for 2 adults and 2 kids. There was plenty of room, though the sofabed looked very uncomfortable. We took advantage of the kitchenette and dishwasher. The kids were able to eat breakfast in the room and we were actually able to bring back our leftovers from lunch and eat them for dinner. A nice option to have. The air conditioning worked great. We like it on the colder side, but I could see how some people might think it too cold. The weather was cool and rainy, so even with the fan turned off on the a/c the room was a little chilly. As I said, good for us but maybe not for some. I would always prefer too cold over too hot. We also used the fitness room. It is one of the best hotel fitness rooms I have seen. Very large and with good equipment. Being so close to Central Park, I was also able to go running in the Park. Overall, I would recommend The Manhattan Club. You can't beat the location with the proximity to Central Park, 5th Avenue, and Times Square. The staff were very friendly and approachable. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “management responsive to complaints”
Reviews.Author: Teachtag
Reviews.Content: I purchased a timeshare at this hotel 3 years ago and several times I experienced difficulty with the room temperature. After complaining to management, I am happy to say that management has been responsive and sensitive to my needs since each time I stay at this hotel. The location is amazing. I walk to Central Park, the theater district and the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service Rude Reception & Maid”
Reviews.Author: brianridd
Reviews.Content: First the good good points Location is Suberb.No need to get subway as it is close to everything Times Square and Central Park. Treatment on check-in was a disgrace we had a Metropolitan room which was next to the hotel aircon unit which was just outside the room on a flat roof on the 2nd floor. We asked to move to another room which after a few moans the receptionist reluctantly agreed to do. The new room was only 2 doors down the replacement room was worse than the original A damp smell, on returning to reception I was told there were no more rooms so I asked if we could change back. Her response was I canâ€™t keep on changing rooms It was 11pm there was no one else in the reception finally we got the original room back. The maid was very was rude as well asking why we needed or sheets changed half way through our 7 night stay, considering we were paying 15 dollars a night for the service. Hotel needs to sent staff on customer service class.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine”
Reviews.Author: wannabefree
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, rooms are definitely ready at 4pm, not earlier. The staff was courteous. We were travelling with our 21 and 22 year old daughters, we stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, primarily because it had to full bathrooms. We decided it was more economical to stay in the 1 bedroom suite with a pull out couch for our daughters than to rent two rooms. The space was fine but the sofa bed was really uncomfortable. I'd probably stay at this hotel again but would not subject our daughters to the sofa bed. The only issue I had with our room was that it always felt a little too warm, and VERY humid. In fairness to the hotel, I never called them to complain, we just weren't in the room that much. Having the kitchenette area was handy, grocery store close by so we were able to eat breakfast in our room each morning. We avoided the slow elevators by using the service elevators which were not fancy but were quick! We also did not have any view whatsoever, our windows faced the interior of the building, brick walls, so there was no natural light in our room at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: DocBrien
Reviews.Content: We are owners at another vacation club and were able to trade for a week at the Manhattan Club. Since my wife had never been to Manhattan before, we were really looking forward to our stay. The Manhattan Club is in a great location, 3 blocks from Central Park, 3 from Columbus Circle, and about 10 from Times Square. Our welcome to the Manhattan Club was excellent with a Bell Hop right there to help with our bags. Check in was easy and our bags were delivered to our room. Be aware, the room we had was not at all like the rooms you see on their web site. Our room was on the 21st floor and had no view (to be expected in Manhattan), but the room was tiny; only slightly larger than a room at standard hotel. The furniture was not the highest class. All of the "suites" come with a refrigerator and microwave. Our microwave never worked, despite notifying the front desk and a promise of it being repaired. Housekeeping is acceptable, but spotty. I noticed a piece of string on the carpet the 2nd day, and it was still there after the 7th day. Give yourself plenty of time when leaving your room, as the elevators are very slow and run on a bizarre cycle. We pushed the down button and actually watched the elevator pass our floor four times going both up and down. Every guest we spoke to commented on it. Some who had been coming to the Manhattan Club for years said that it was actually much better than it had been in the past. I shudder to think what it was like in the past. The lobby staff, housekeeping, and concierge were all very courteous and helpful. The biggest negative for us were the repeated phone call requests to attend a "property tour" and get free show tickets. We had already purchased show tickets and didn't care to sit through a sales presentation for Manhattan Club ownership, so we politely told them "no" - four times. The last time we actually had to tell the "leave us alone" to get them to stop. Free WiFi is included with your room, but it is so slow as to almost be unusable at times. Still it was helpful to us, when we could get it to work. All and all, I would recommend this property if you can put up with the pushy sales people and the small rooms. Not good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to visit, not a great timeshare to own”
Reviews.Author: snork314
Reviews.Content: I am an owner at The Manhattan Club. It is a terrific place to stay and the hotel is nice and the staff is professional and couteous. If you are thinking about purchasing a timeshare at The Manhattan Club, buyer beware. The resale value is less than 10% of the amount you will pay if you purchase directly from the onsite sales/marketing staff. The reason is that the annual maintenence fees range from $1,800-$3,000/yr. Read notes from Aug. 4, 2010 owners meeting at tmcnyowners.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: tripsntraps
Reviews.Content: 3 blocks from Central Park, 1 block from the Metro, around the block from Carnegie Hall, 15 minute walk to Times Square -- all these add up to one good reason I will re-book (stayed 8 days) when I return next summer. Do Expedia or Priceline otherwise, you'll be paying a lot more if you go through the hotel...unless you do the 90 minute timeshare presentation, in which case the discounted price is about the same. Manhattan Club is far enough away from the maddening crush of tourists but close enough to everything. Area is safe. The kitchenette in our one bedroom was great to have -- there is a supermarket 2 blocks away and of course lots of restaurants all around. Skip the continental breakfast on the 26th floor. It's overpriced. Room was spacious enough for 4 people. The pullout sofa bed in LR was comfortable. Service was good. Asked for 6 extra pillows (3 of us have back problems) -- housekeeping balked for a second then sent them up within 2 minutes. Our room, 2513, was 104 degrees when we arrived at 10:30 pm. Called down for service and an engineer was up in 2 minutes. Meanwhile housekeeping sent up a fan and two bottles of chilled water with a note of apology for the inconvenience. Took a while to cool down but it finally did. Stingy with the coffee -- asked for extra packets and they wanted to charge us. Complained to Asst. Mgr -- left voice mail -- never got a call back. Leaving really early? Go around the corner and grab a cab. Don't let the bellman tell you there may not be any cabs at 4am and convince you to pay $50 for a private car to LaGuardia. This is NY after all! Take advantage of Concierge service if you're looking for hard-to-get Broadway show tickets. They have a runner ($25 service fee per tix) who will grab tickets for you at group rate, no higher than mezzanine seats...so you're not sitting in nosebleed seats. They call you on your cell if they were able to get them and you pick them up at the Concierge desk at end of day. No waiting around. You end up paying full price with the service fee but it beats spending your entire morning in the heat, lining up for cheap tickets at Time Square. Forget the tour buses. Grab a guidebook and walk. Much more interesting and free! Friends took us to Spice Market--trendy, with excellent cuisine, in the Chelsea Area. Take the bike guided tour in Central Park if you've never been there. We negotiated our fee and got an hour's ride for their usual 30 minute tour (must've been a slow day--did it on a weekday, later in the p.m.).

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: naigib
Reviews.Content: Was a bit concerned after booking this appartment to see some negative reviews - but they were totally unfounded. Stayed for a week with partner and 15 year old daughter in a smallish but stylish room with a very comfortable sofa bed, small but classy kitchen area and lovely bathroom; which was beautifully serviced daily. No view to speak of (this is NY) but great location for Central Park, Fifth Avenue, Broadway, Times Square, Midtown; and subway to go any further. The buses are also very handy for nipping on and off to cover shorter block distances (and cool off) and were included in the weekly subway pass; which was good value. Subway can be a bit confusing at first - but easy to work out where you are lost because of the 'block' system! There was a very brief telephone attempt to interest us in the timeshare options but no further hassle when we politely declined and contact with staff was always polite and courteous. The lifts were usually fine although they could be slightly slow at busy times - but no real problem. Took the stairs a couple of times (from 2nd) and they do deposit you directly in the lobby of the adjacent hotel - which is slightly confusing at first; but again, no real problem! We all loved the 'hotel' and New York and will return to both!

Reviews.Title: “Location!!Location!!!Location!!going to return”
Reviews.Author: mkb607
Reviews.Content: My cousin & I just spent a week in a studio apt. One of the best things about the hotel is the location. It is a very nice hotel, clean, good service, nice employees & a great location. We had a very small kitchen area, microwave, frig, coffee pot, dishes, yes they are plastic. We had breakfast everyday in the room & also stopped & picked up something from the vendors on the street or at World Foods & had lunch or our evening meal a couple times. It is true that the elevator is slow at times. We were on the 2nd floor, so we did not really have a problem. We did not know when we booked that it is a timeshare hotel. We did have maid service everyday. We did go to the sales presentation, & there was no high pressure. we did buy 5 nights to use at a later date. We want to return to NYC Christmas time of 2011. We were given two free tickets to see South Pacific which was within walking distance at the Lincoln Center. There were theaters, restaurants, fast food joints, subway, of Central Park all very close. This was our first trip to NYC & it was much easier to get around that I thought it would be, also not as expensive as I thought. We were very lucky to have a Big Apple Greeter met us our first day there. We have to say a special thanks to S to also to BAG. They have a great service. I would recommend the Manhattan Club. Like I already stated, we have already paid for our next trip. I almost forgot about the Today show. We walked to Rockefeller Center & saw the announcers from Today show. Again great location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!!”
Reviews.Author: R2D2CapeTown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Manhattan Club (over the 4th July weekend 2010) and all I can say is that the overall experience was wonderful. As confirmed by previous members, the location was awesome. The lifts worked fine too! The staff were friendly (especially Lizette - what a pleasant front desk assistant!). I would definitely return to this location. Mr. R Jaga

Reviews.Title: “Liked it Alot”
Reviews.Author: tempdragon
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Manhattan Club. It was a timeshare exchange through RCI. Check in was quick at the Manhattan Club. We were assigned to an interior view 1 bedroom on the 24th floor. The room was clean and the facilities were in good shape, minus the elevators as others had mentioned. It was slow. It seemed to me the issue was that two out of the four lifts were reserved for the penthouse units/floors. Several times, we used the two freight elevators behind the lobby. The suite was kept nice and cool and noise wasnâ€™t an issue. The 1 bedroom consists of a bedroom separated from the living area via a door. In addition to the one bath in the bedroom, there was a Â¾ bath in the living room area. This was nice as there were 3 of us. There was a microwave, however no cooking stove top. There was a mini fridge in the room. Itâ€™s NYC anywaysâ€¦ Who cooks? Daily cleaning was provided and the housekeeping staff did an excellent job everyday. All the staff appeared cheerful and we experienced no problems. The were no spas or pools, however there was a good gym on the top floor. There were 3 flat panel TVâ€™s along with all the necessary machines, including free weights to work off all the great meals to be had nearby. I slept on the sofa bed one night and that was enough for me. Did not feel comfortable, but was okay with my little one. Overall, liked it a lot. It was in a great location with the subway a block away. You couldnâ€™t ask for a better location. Tip: at 55th Street and 9th Avenue, there is a laundromat where you can do some laundry if you have to. Also next door on 9th Avenue, there is a bike shop, Liberty Bicycles that rents bicycles for $6 an hour. Looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “All you could want and more!”
Reviews.Author: campo84748
Reviews.Content: Ive been to this hotel/ timeshare resort many times. I try to get it on ebay for a discount on a minutes notice. I do live in Brooklyn and it seems worlds away from the city so we like to go now and then and stay, eat, drink & play in the city center. The manhattan club is perfect. The location is perfect, right near central park, carnigie hall, times square, countless other attractions like the met. Most rooms have a seperate bedroom with a huge cozy king sized bed. Top qualtiy sheets, Ice cold AC. Flat screen TVs. 2 1 in the living room and 1 in bedroom. 2 beautiful marble bathrooms. Bathrobes. A kitchenette with everything but a stove (Hey NYC is for eating out!). 2 walk in closets, iron with ironing board, sleeper sofa..living room furniture. All very very nice. Remember this is more timeshare then hotel so dont expect room service but so many places nearby deleiver whatever you want round the clock. These units have much more then most NYers live in. Much more. Understand that before you complain about these units. Your not in Disney, your in NYC. That being said you wont be spending a lot of time in your room, though you'll want to because they are that comfortable. If i had a complaint it would be that someone called me to ask i wanted to take a 90 minute timeshare tour for 100$. I said no thanks and that was that. Carpeting could use a cleaning in the room, but again, no biggy. I love this hotel and location and i will return as much as i can!!! Once youve stayed in another hotel in NYC you will see you get no room at all, and this is beautiful and clean. No bedbugs or anyother things you could fine even at the waldorf. Free wi fi and use of computers and printers in conference room. Free breakfast included.

Reviews.Title: “swish apartments, clean and very well located”
Reviews.Author: dancingpotato82
Reviews.Content: very clean and the apartment was big enough for 3 of us, the sofa bed was a little uncomfortable and the fridge noisy but, the rest of the amenities made up for it . Would definitely stay here again, it was a really wonderful place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Don't Come with High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: icecubebabbee
Reviews.Content: Booked this room through an RCI (timeshare program) special. The photos of the rooms were lovely and looked extremely spacious (then again when do they not). I was a little skeptical and had to call the hotel to make sure that it was enough for my family of four. The front desk assured me that a STUDIO (in NY?! ridiculous) was enough to fit my family, so I went with it. The price was fairly reasonable for New York ($300 for the night, which at NY is reasonable) and I love New York to bits. I was so excited as I arrived in Manhattan and began looking for the hotel out of the car. The lobby was mediocre at best and having lived in the Waldorf and the Hilton, the lobby did not even compare with those fine hotels. The first red flag was that the room was not ready at 2pm and later at 3pm. A lady in front of us in the line complained that she had been waiting for her room since 7am in the morning. The bellhops were no better. There was one tiny skinny man and a bigger one. The bigger one left the skinny little one to do most of the work (mind you, we had seven pieces of luggage) and gave us attitude when it came time for the tipping. Obviously we gave the smaller one a substantially larger tip, at the expense of us having to quarrel with an obnoxious bellhop that felt his tip was too little. The room was a lot smaller than what I had imagined and smelled strongly of cigarette smoke, even though it claimed to be a no smoking room. I was furious that the front desk felt that the size of the room would be suitable for a family of four with two teenage boys. After some reasoning with the front desk, they gave us a slightly larger room but was still way to small for my family. Now it wasn't all bad, even though it seems like it is. I found the bathroom to be of a generous size, especially for New York. There was also free wifi which surprised me a lot! The location is also impeccable. Overall, I would not book this hotel ever again, especially for its selling price of around USD $500. It really dampened my experience in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Definately not the room on the website!”
Reviews.Author: Fortyniner
Reviews.Content: I researched hotels in Manhattan extensively and my final decision was based on photographs and amenities information online. We were booked in for over a week and I was shocked to find our room was not as expected. We had no view of anything - in fact our window was frosted over!!! Dark and dingy .The room had not table and chairs or a dishwasher. Though who needs a dishwasher when this time share provides only PLASTIC knives and forks, plates and tumblers!! Talk about picnic in Manhattan!! Not even a wine glass for a civilised drink at the end of the day. I rang the front desk to confirm we were in the right room given the photograhs etc and they just said " well not all rooms have a table and chairs"! Housekeeping was excellent. Lifts ARE VERY slow. Front desk at check in very efficent and welcoming. I would advise that unless you are genuinely interested in buying into plastic timeshare your time can be much better spent waiting in line in Times Square from 2pm daily for half price tickets to the show of your choice. Try the EUROPA Cafe for eats as well as DUKES who have a comprehensive buffet. This hotel is in a great location but there are lots of others around too. We really got the dud room so based on that I won't be recommending to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience”
Reviews.Author: prissySanDiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week on our RCI points in a full one bedroom (suite 2401) There are 113 one bedroom units on floors 12-25. They range from 500-700 sq. ft. Ours was 622 sq.ft. at the end of a hallway next to a storage room so it was quiet. The windows looked out to the so called courtyard which was a brick building well. Not a problem for me because I didn't come to NYC to sit in the room and look out the window. I was glad I didn't get the 56th street side as it might not have been so quiet. When you take the elevators (2 of them on the smaller size) watch to see if it skips your floor. Housekeeping told us they sometime get "keyed" to skip floors. If so- head around the corner to the service elevator which is never busy. Can't complain about the elevators as other have done. Both elevators are clearly marked- just look for the signs. We arrived on a Friday night from JFK. Before we could get out of the town car ( use Carmel car service- fabulous and $5 less than the taxis) the bellman had removed all of our luggage from the trunk and taken it inside. There was another bellman to great you. We arrived at 6pm- no line-very very nice polite check in. Our bags were promptly delivered to our room. The suite has a bathroom with tub/shower which is quite large and shower only bathroom that is small/medium size. Nice linens on a king bed in master. They will give you a rollaway bed if you don't like the pull out couch bed. My friend didn't mind it. We anticipated the dreaded bar found on most pull out couches, but it wasn't there. Maid service was wonderful. On the first night when we returned to the room at midnight we couldn't figure out how to shut the windows we had opened and initially thought there was no air conditioning. We called for assistance. With 2 minutes a maintenance man was there to show 2 women how to close the windows and an engineer to show us how to turn on the air conditioner. (Can't ask for better service than that) They have express check out and handled our bags beautifully. We had a Manhattan cocktail (thought it appropriate on our first night) at the bar on the 26th floor. It was $14 but it was perfectly made. There was a bowl of nibble snacks with the drink. Owner services (the Ambassador Club/sales office) called me a few weeks before my arrival and told me to call the front desk 2 weeks in advance if I wanted to make any special requests. The 1 bedroom suite is good for 2-4 people. More would be too cozy. We went to the business center on the 26th floor to quickly send postcards(check out the Manhattan Club website- they have really cool on line postcards to send) and to run boarding passes. A lot of people hogged the 6 computers and looked like they were working, rather than doing quick checks. It was ridiculous because they have free internet access in the room- just bring your laptop with you if you need to spend that much time on a computer. I will definitely return to the Manhattan Club. I am a very particular person and often RCI properties are not to my standard. This was not the case here.

Reviews.Title: “This was a real treat, location, service and safety. Couldn't ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: Sassy05_10
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay, close to everything and the concierge was so helpful. The unit was clean and had all the necessities. Location made our stay wonderful and woke up to look out the window at Central Park. Would be happy to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service... GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby143
Reviews.Content: After witnessing how poor service was previously at this property, I was pleasantly surprised at how nice and efficient the staff has become since our first visit. A special â€œshout outâ€� to Christina at the front desk, even after a long night shift, she was professional, pleasant and helpful with our early check-in! Much different than what we experienced in the past. The housekeeping staff was on top of things all week. Our two JR. Executive suites were in good condition. The head of housekeeping was really concerned about a spot on the carpet. He made sure it was taken care of before we checked in one of our rooms. This unit is the 1 bath unit. There is plenty of room a for a couple. The mini fridge, microwave, dishes and dishwasher are all you need in Manhattan. We were on the 21st floor, so street noise was not an issue for us. FREE Wi-Fi! The gym is really nice and well equippedâ€¦ along with the penthouse bar / lounge. The many complaints about the â€œslowâ€� elevators can be avoided by using the elevators to the left of the front desk when possible. A non-issue for us. The location is as good as it gets in Manhattan. Close to Central Park, Times Square and more importantlyâ€¦ multiple SUBWAY stations! As far as the t/s presentationsâ€¦ though one of the managers and I disagreed on a few thingsâ€¦ the salesman was a pro. Since we are in sales, high pressure is not a problem for us, but he was not that way at all. If we could justify the maintenance feesâ€¦ weâ€™d be owners. For now, weâ€™ll have to settle on trading or renting there. That said, the property is in good condition and exceeded our expectations. We would stay here every time we visit NYC if possible. Last, itâ€™s good to see MC managementâ€™s on TA. It shows they care what travelers have to say. Ratings: Location 10â€¦ Service 9â€¦ Unit 8. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room, nice front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: bandman
Reviews.Content: As everyone has mentioned, this hotel has a fabulous location. One block from Broadway, the subway, two blocks from great food on 8th avenue, and 2 blocks from a great little grocery/deli on 6th. If you are like us, and you go all day long and will enjoy a meal back in your condo/room, try the Ernst Klein Fine foods. Among other things they had the best chowder I tasted while in NYC. The rooms are nice sized by NYC standards with two very nice baths in each 1 BR condo. The bedroom is about the size of a normal NYC hotel room, and then you have a living room with a small, yet functional, 4 seat dinette. The partial kitchen has a fridge and a microwave. If you will need one, bring your own bottle opener. I find that the unit needs some major updating, but when you are in NYC you leave in the morning and go home in the evening. My family probably spends more time in the unit than most, and we enjoyed it. Several of the people have posted about rude front desk employees. I found the front desk to be great. The concierge was rude, as was the bellman named Jason who actually questioned the amount of the tip I gave him. I should have taken it back, but I didn't. I did speak with the office in Pennsylvania prior to going to NYC. I will say that the people on the phone from the main office were among the rudest people I have ever dealt with at any hotel. They were not onsite, so once you get there you do't have to ask them anything. Elevators -- not bad at all -- not even once during the week did we have an unacceptable wait time. On a scale of 1-10 I would have given the Manhattan Club a 9 based primarily on location.. For TA it is a solid 4 out of 5.

Reviews.Title: “DREARY DUMP.”
Reviews.Author: alan6668
Reviews.Content: Needed 1 bedroom suite which the booking company assured us of. Their "suite" was only a single room unsuitable for a family. The room in no way resembled the misleading picture on their websight. When you book, they charge your credit card and consider it non-cancellable. After taking 1 look at the dingy room, we refused to stay and then spent 4-6 months fighting with them to get the charges cancelled which they refused. Finally, VISA was kind enough to back us up and cancel the charge. Stay away at all cost.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising - Not Upper Class Place At All”
Reviews.Author: Imfullofwonder
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here if: 1. You want a room like the pictures found on their website online. What you REALLY get is not a suite at all but a small room with a bed in it and a two person sofa that pulls out into the most uncomfortable of "beds". The springs polk through - it hurts when you roll over. The fridge is the size of a cardboard box and it's under a counter. No table, no chairs. 2. You want the air conditioner to work. It was HOT! We had to ask housekeeping for a fan to be able to sleep; and it was April! 3. The elevator to work. It doesn't. Get on your walking shoes! [And your pepper spray] The stairs and hallways are dark and kind of scary. 4. The door to lock. It didn't. We moved the furniture in front of the door for the night to feel more secure. 5. Someone to help you. We asked the front desk to help us with all these things and they basically brushed us off like lint. Not helpful at all. I never write reviews but had to in this case; I was VERY disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LTRCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Second visit to the Manhattan Club. Both times we went with concerns after reading reviews. We had no real problem. We asked for an outside room which we were given. Only problems were that room was a bit stuffy so we had to open the windows. Also, there was no bedside table with a reading lamp on one side of the bed. We requested a floor lamp, but they wee unable to find one. The elevators were not a problem and our interactions with the staff were all fine

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jeannicer
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place is the location. 3 blocks south of Central Park, 3 blocks from Times Square. Rooms are average size for NYC. We had a one-bedroom which was sufficient for our family of two parents and two teens. The room was remodeled and nice. Comes with a microwave and dishwasher and coffee pot. Coffee and tea provided. No stove or oven. Pull-out sleeper sofa was very uncomfortable, as most are. Our kids took the mattress off and put it on the floor every night. Extra charge for daily housekeeping but it was nice to come back to fully cleaned room every night. Warning about the elevators: they won't stop on your floor after they are loaded to a certain weight limit. After waiting for 10 minutes for an elevator to stop, we got smart . After that, we pressed both the up and down buttons so that whatever one was empty or near-empty would stop. We ordered pizza and pasta and sandwiches from nearby Ray's pizza and the food was good and cheap and huge. Could have ordered 1 entree for every two people. Take the short walk west to 9th in Hells Kitchen to eat. Food around Times sq is insanely expensive and bad. Food in Hells Kitchen is great and cheap. Azuri has the best falafel EVER. Even our kids, who swear they don't like falafel, loved it. West Way Diner cheap and good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location”
Reviews.Author: skreps99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Manhattan Club for 3 nights in March. I had booked as a hotel, not as a timeshare exchange, and the price was reasonable and comparable to other Manhattan hotels. We only had one phone call asking if we wanted to tour the property for broadway tickets, dinner, or Visa card. We said no. We pulled up in the car and the valet took it for a tip and $28/day. Easy. We were early and allowed us to register but had to wait till 4pm for the room. They gave us an option of waiting in the lounge on the 26th floor. We stowed our luggage with the concierge desk (for tip) and hit the streets. Returned at 4, got the room and the luggage was delivered. (tip). I was surprised our room was smaller than the picture showing the round table, but it was fine for just us two- comfy bed, nice sofa (bed), ottoman, furniture closets and flat screen over a desk, mini kitchen with fridge and plastic serving ware, small but lovely bathroom. We were only on the 2nd floor, but the noise didn't really bother us. Another reviewer has posted pictures that were almost identical to ours. The location is super, with Central Park, metro, restaurants, MoMA and shopping nearby. We ate at Carnegie Deli, just around the corner (and others farther away) The exercise room is very well equipped. We had free wifi with easy hookup. My only real complaint was that we could have used another luggage rack in the room (there was one) as we didn't fully unpack. I used the only other chair for my suitcase, but then we had none for the desk area. But, then, when we requested a DVD player, the housekeeping quickly brought (tip) a HUGE ancient concoction of double dvd/vhs which needed to be used as a tuner for the piggyback dvd player (????) and mammoth cables hanging all over the desk area. That took up alot of space. Was quite unsightly. OK, it was raining, so we watched our own Netflix some! I'd stay here again. In this pricerange, it was the best hotel I've been in in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy stay but do not go for the timeshare presentation”
Reviews.Author: dancesforlove
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location!! We had a nice room with two baths, two wide screen TV's with full cable AND moviesand were able to bring in food to eat in which was nice. Right near Central Park. Go and enjoy stay. BUT.... Cons: Street noise is very bad bring earplugs. Slow elevators Be forewarned: they are timeshare and they are going to try to lure you in with a "free gift card" and take up an entire day of your vacation time trying to get you buy into the timeshare. They call and call to get you to see their presentation. Do not be fooled they are overstocked with product. Avoid the timeshare presentation of the Manhattan Club like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “loved staying here.”
Reviews.Author: hoclinda
Reviews.Content: Close to Central Park,Time Square,Broadway. Well equiped room for self catering.Staff were really helpfull and friendly.Its timeshare but we didnt have any bother with anybody trying to sell ,they left us alone which was great! This was a really good place to stay .We would love to go there again. One problem was the lifts! You waited an age for one!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Management is rude, incompetant, dishonest, in short, NOT a classy place!”
Reviews.Author: welltravelled94
Reviews.Content: I'm compelled to warn anyone contemplating a visit to the Manhattan Club that you, like I was, may be very disappointed with your reception and the lack of hospitality at this facility. The check-in was a nightmare! The front desk was rude, incompetant and outright dishonest. Other than it's location, this facility is less than mediocre. The one bedroom suite is small and not suited for 4 people. The elevator service is inadequate. The additional fees to have another member of your party check in first ($59.00), housekeeping ($25.00 daily), late checkout ($50.00 per 15 minutes) and others,were a huge ripoff--made me feel like I was at the 'Manhattan Vampire Club". However, box cookies in the afternoon are free.Think twice bebore coming here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Break at our home away from Home!”
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and boy were we surprised! They put us in one of their newer rooms, yay! We came in at 1pm and they held onto our baggage an no fee...we just tipped. We always exchange our timeshare when possible at this particular hotel due to the location and ammenities! We love having a mini fridge, sink, microwave, and they even provide coffee, popcorn, plates, cups, utensils, and bath & body soaps everyday! I always left a tip before housekeeping came in. We noticed the fresh flowers in every floor which was new since our last visit. You have free use to their business center so we didn't take our laptops, which is great! We were asked at check in if we were interested in the timeshare presentation, but I let them know right away that we already owned some and were not interested...they never asked again! Bring Ear Plugs 'cause no matter what floor you're on you'll hear everything outside! The studios had a $15/night service fee which they say goes towards the staff and business center. Larger rooms have more fees... Took Limo Service from airport which was less than taking a taxi ( I save $15 per trip this time), so I don't know about their parking fee...I'm sure it's high! Easy to catch a cab or get on the subway from their entrance! We stayed for 4 nights this time and paid our exchange fee of $99 plus $60 at check out for maintence fee. I think that since we purchased our timeshare (another location) that it was worth the savings at much higher end hotels. We will definitely come back here as often as we can! Many nice restaurants are walking distance, but we loved all the Ethnic Restaurants on 9th ave...our favs. were Empanada Mama, Eatery, Q Thai Restaurant. We also went to Mariella for some pizza just like Gail & Oprah recommended, Papillon for Sat. Opera Night, Serendipity, and Carniege Deli! Many delis and grocery stores are just around the corner. Time Warner building on Columbus Circle is where we hung out when it rained plus they have a whole foods...brought back dinner for that night. If you want dim sum take a taxi to Ping's on Mott St. Yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location- comes with some baggage”
Reviews.Author: Surfed69
Reviews.Content: This is a timeshare hotel, but it was not clear this is what we were getting into when I booked online through their website. The booking was just like booking any other hotel. Then the emails and phone calls started, trying to sign me up for a tour of the property (of course they give you a voucher for dinner or something like that). One phone call to me before our trip confirming our reservation was completely wrong, that worried me a bit. Part of our package was for a continental breakfast for two in the members club and a free days parking(their parking rate for our 5-day stay was very reasonable $28/day). Glad I didn't pay for the breakfast. Our room was clean, the mattres was excellent, the master bath was tiny, the second bath off the entrance to our suite was much better. The "Courtyard view" is a window to 3 walls of other buildingsThe workout room is large and well equipped. They offered free internet connection but had to ask for it. They didn't offer it up and it wasn't easy to connect. Location, location, location! Can walk to everything mid-town has to offer. Overall a good stay, reasonably priced, not over the top fancy but well priced for location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect, from a tough critic”
Reviews.Author: sinasohn
Reviews.Content: This is my kind of place, spacious, clean, first class, free wifi, great service, AMAZING location. I was amazed that I actually found something with my RCI points that I thought was great. My wife, who is pickier than me loved it too. We have a big family too and there was plenty of room. Two bathrooms was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The Manhattan Club”
Reviews.Author: lunaticcorpse
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to have very comfortable accomodations. Travelling with a family or group, it is ideal as a place to sleep and relax. The services were excellent, catering to just about every need and giving excellent suggestions, whether it be for dining or theatre or a museum. The location is perfect. Right between Times Square and Central Park and across the street from Carnegie Hall

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: jtvargas
Reviews.Content: Our experience staying at the Manhattan Club was pleasureable. We stayed in a one bedroom and it was spacious for New York standards. There was a fitness room on site,but we didn't use the facilities. They served fresh coffee and tea and cookies from 11am - 4pm in their Owner's Lounge. It's centrally located. We were able to walk to Central Park, Times Square, Broadway and subway entrances.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal If You Can Get It.”
Reviews.Author: jerrymsf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a week in September. This was our second stay here. Both times we were in a one bedroom suite. The suite consists of a separate bedroom with a king bed, flat screen TV, closet, plenty of drawers and a bathroom with tub and shower. Then there is a separate living room with a TV, an eating area, a mini kitchen and another bathroom with a shower. There is daily maid service, good towels and bath amenities. We were on the 25th floor with an east view and windows that opened. The decor is functional, mid-level but clean and more than adequate. On our stay the elevators were running and our limited staff encounters wer also fine. We had done the time share tour last visit so they left us alone. I read the mixed reviews. I know they were having elevator problems but they are now ok. Of course, the location is the best. Easy walking distance to MOMA, Lincoln Center, Metropolitan Museum, Central Park, Whole Foods, etc. Plenty of restaurants in walking distance and easy subway and bus access. From our perspective, the best part is that we get in on a timeshare swap thru RCI and the cost is minimal compared to the rack rate. As one of the very few timeshares in NYC its not easy to get into but our timeshare company seems to make a deal to make it available. Don't know if I would pay $500 + a nite but as long as we can do a timeshare swap its a great deal and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with the best possible location”
Reviews.Author: jas2004
Reviews.Content: I love the Manhattan Club for its location and the energy of New York city. The hotel is well kept and the room size is large for a typical Manhanttan hotel. I can't wait to get back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: lesorlem
Reviews.Content: A last-minute booking but well worth it! Stayed here from 30 July 2009 for 10nts. Spacious rooms & friendly staff. Bath & Body Works amenities. The beds are quite heavenly. Nothing much to say about the lobby and the elevators though, but it's no biggie. We especially loved the business centre on the 26th floor - 5 computers readily available for guests to use, and you can print, too. Times Square is just a 5minute walk. Close to lots of shopping like GAP, Daffy's, etc. Subway is almost next door (57th Street) - Columbus Circle is less than a 5min walk. Very close to Central Park. We really liked this place.

Reviews.Title: “Heads up.”
Reviews.Author: AmandaO90
Reviews.Content: Lets start by saying it's 3:30 in the morning, I'm physically in my room here at the Manhattan club, and I'm so upset I had to write a review. When trying to make reservations one person told us there was nothing available for almost a year. When we tried back again a few days later, a gentleman said " We have anything you want available, just give me the date you want to come and well make your reservation." and with no problem, we were booked. Strange. We get here and TRY to check in at 4 p.m, which is the check in time. We proceeded to wait 45 minutes because our room was "not ready." The lobby filled in no time with people who's rooms were "not ready." The front desk clerk gave us attitude for asking her how much longer it would be. If check out is at 11 and check in is at 4, does it really take 5 hours to clean the room? (word round the building:if you stay past 11 they charge you $50. But no compensation for making us wait in the lobby?) We get to the room and there are paint chips in random places throughout it. Wall paper falling off, numbers on the granite tiles (where the builders were counting pieces or something), there is a huge scaffolding outside our window, the toilet paper roll fell apart because there was no spring in it (tp now sits on the floor), the toilet seat in the other bathroom fell off upon sitting on it,all of the brass fixtures are corroding, the blow dryer burnt out, and the elevators are extremely slow. Ok, not a huge deal. The thing that did it for me was moving from the bedroom to the living/sitting room with the pullout sofa bed. The bed was broken. The entire couch came along with the bed while pulling it out. One side would come out, the other would go in. I finally wrestle it out....3:30 in the morning...to find that when I sit on it, it collapses in on me like a sandwich. I am now forced to sleep horizontally, in the crack/fold of the mattress with my feet on a chair. It makes me think, "someone came in here and made this broken bed up with sheets, a blanket and a pillow. Then put it back into the sofa, and left it for the next customer/guest" I am not pleased. To say the least the location is great and the internet works. The TV's do too, but the remotes are missing battery covers. The concierges were ok, got the task done, even though they bickered back and forth about a location of a certain store. This is not as upscale a place as they sell it to be. Maybe a "Howard Johnson does Manhattan." Very disappointing for the amount of money they want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ferocity
Reviews.Content: I was very worried after reading the awful reviews, but our stay was great. The room was large and clean, with a queen bed and a pull-out couch. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Central Park & Times Square”
Reviews.Author: broadfi2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Manhattan Club for our annual trip to NYC for a Guggehneim exhibit. We found this place through a Home show in Maryland and knew it was a 'time-share' and we were going to sit through the 'time-share sell'. The hotel is going through renovations but great quality of the rooms. Recommend the 26th floor bar as he pours a mean scotch on the rocks (little ice). Typical elevator problem that every highrise has in Manhattan, slow rise rate so it takes a while but we were going in and out not during 'heavy-rush times'. Would stay there again for the location to Central park, Subway, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware...Stay at the Park Central next door”
Reviews.Author: virginiapeanut
Reviews.Content: I use to own a timeshare here. The staff for the most part are RUDE. The tv was broken on one occasion and no one ever showed up to check it. I have seen this place go from very nice to pretty bad over the years. Wall paper coming off the walls, cracked tiles in the bathroom, overall maintenace of the place is very poor. The conceirge desk while helpful, wern't there some of the time and some of them act like they're doing you a favor by helping you. Someone needs to tell them, IT IS YOUR JOB TO HELP ME! Another time the all of the elevator's were broken, yes, broken and they had us go through through the back , in a dark hall and use the service elevators. The elevators in general take forever to get too. The front desk are awful people to deal with...I showed up and they told me check in wasn't for another hour. I waited, and waited only to have some guy walk right up and get his key. When I asked why I was still waiting, there was a snappy, answer back...your room is not ready. The key is to ask are there any rooms open? They will call and bug you on the phone to buy the timeshare. DON"T BUY!!!!! PLEASE DON'T BUY. This place started with inflated prices and now, have sky rocketed into more inflated prices. AND YOU WILL NEVER SELL IT AND YOU WILL NEVER GET YOUR MONEY BACK AND THE FEES ARE OUTRAGEOUS AND KEEP GOING UP. When I bought one I spent $20,000 and when I sold it, no one could buy it, because they have a buy back clause that they get first crack at it. You don't know if they will buy it, but no one else can either. Then when they buy it back, which happened to me...I only got $4,000. YES, $4,000. iT IS THE BIGGEST LEAGAL SCAM I HAVE EVER SEEN! STAY CLEAR!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: WISuzyqueue
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at the Manhattan Club and on this visit we landed a huge, two bathroom suite on the 22nd floor. It was by far the nicest room I've ever had in NYC. I've stayed in smaller units here which are nice but somewhat cramped. We love the refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher, which makes it nice for leftovers. The king size bed had thick comforters and even the pull out couch was comfortable. Large towels, daily maid service, robes, made it even nicer. One of the best things is the location. The subway station is just down the block so you can get anywhere in Manhattan. You are only two blocks from Central Park and across the street from Carnegie Hall. Down on 7th Ave. are the Carnegie Deli and Stage Deli to grab a huge sandwich - you can store your leftovers in the frige. You can easily walk to Times Square. The staff is adequate, not overly friendly. They had to search awhile for my reservation but once they found it, everything was fine. I would highly recommend this hotel. It is clean and very convenient to get anywhere in the City. Only gripe is elevator is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: AMDDerry
Reviews.Content: I would not class these suites as 4* we booked a suite for 2couples which was very small and cramped. It was a open plan with living area with sofa bed and small bathroom with no window so got very steamy & stuffy.Our air conditioning didnt work and the heat was horendous when we opened the window for fresh air it was noisy. There was just enough room to get the sofa bed opened out in the living area, when opened out it was almost touching the fridge & units and the couple that slept on it ended up sleeping with the fridge door opened to try cool down. The carpet in the suite& the corriders was worn and tired. The location was good but everything else was really dissappointing especially when it was fairly expensive the pictures were very very deceiving. Much better to stay in a hotel

Reviews.Title: “When is a suite not a suite?”
Reviews.Author: Sinclair60
Reviews.Content: I booked one of the Manhattan Club's Metropolitan Suites (through Expedia.com) for 1st week in March for my birthday. I was very , very disappointed! On my initial booking request form I asked for an outward looking suite and as high up as was available - preferably above the 9th floor. When we arrived we discovered that our suite was on the second floor. I questioned this and pointed out that I had specifically stated that I wanted a high floor but was informed, by very dismissive staff, that ALL the Metropolitan Suites are situated on the second floor! I was really flaming mad as no one had had the courtesy or the decency to let me know when I was booking, that this was the case. Then we went up to our 'suite' only to discover that it was not a 'suite' but one room with a pull down setee! Not enough room to swing the proverbial cat in and when the sofa was pulled down you could not even squeeze past it to get to the bathroom - you had to jump over it! We had booked the 'suite' as it was supposed to have a separate bedroom (according to the descprition and photograph on the web page of their ad.) and accommodate 4 people, there were three of us, myself, my brother and my female friend, she then had to stay with my sister and other friends, as there was absolutely no way we all could have stayed there comfortably for one week. After travelling 3,000 miles from Scotland to say that I was bitterly disappointed is an understatement.
