I did complain to the sultry, disinterested staff who informed me that it had nothing to do with the Manhattan Club, I would have to complain to Expedia and that it could take two days to get a hold of them. I'm afraid I feel I was well and truly very expensively conned and would not recommend the web site or the Manhattan Club to anyone I know intending to spend time in NY. First impressions are usually lasting ones!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Lors68
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were on our first visit to New York to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversary. We used our points system and booked the Manhattan Club 10 months in advance of our trip. Our accommodation was a junior studio which was ideal for our purpose. It was clean, functional and the bed was so comfortable (I want their pillows). There was limited cooking facilities but we had no intention of doing any cooking. Making coffee was our limit. The location was absolutely perfect for getting around New York especially Broadway, Times Square, Central Park, 5th Avenue and subways. During our week we received one phone call about attending a presentation, which we declined, and were never bothered again. Yes, we could have received vouchers for meals, tickets for shows but our time was more valuable. The only day we had a problem waiting for lifts was on check out, but it wasn't unbearable . When we go back to New York we will definately try and stay at the Manhattan Club.

Reviews.Title: “Too many obstacles tarnish otherwise great location.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan714
Reviews.Content: This time share/hotel is in a great location on W56, between 7th and 8th Aves. Close to Central Park, Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center. The elevator wait daily was horrible. The persistent phone calls from time share sales staff wanting "90 minutes of your time" was very bothersome. Bellmen and front desk staff were very indifferent. there is a lounge on the 26th floor, open to members and hotel guests alike. Michael, one of the bartenders, was an asset to this property. If you are able to secure a great room rate, don't mind long elevator waits and can handle your room phone ringing when trying to relax, then go for it. Otherwise, I say find a reputable hotel that has a repuation for customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Timeshare Bully”
Reviews.Author: bevolonghorn
Reviews.Content: There was a lady sales representative that had a "you owe me attitude" trying to sell us a timeshare. She was very rude, unprofessional, and her "aggressive" sales tactics were a total turn off. If I had a $100,000 in my back pocket, I would not buy a timeshare at this location. Everyone that we met in New York was very nice except for this one chick. I know that economic times are bad, however no one should be that desperate for a sale. She made comments such as, "you lied..." "your aunt lied..." "are you not in the same financial bracket as your aunt..." These comments were totally uncalled for by this so-called professional. She needs to get one thing straight--I am the customer, and you SIMPLY work there. If you are there for the timeshare promotion, I am hoping that you are treated with respect. The RESPECT that I did not receive at the presentation. I love New York...not Tiffany!

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are small and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: timeguy1
Reviews.Content: Couch and Chair in room had worn out fabric. The showerhead was broken and did not work right. Bathroom has small sink with no counter. Pull out bed was no good. Save your money and stay in a regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Scoobie_8
Reviews.Content: We traded one of our RCI weeks and booked close to a year in advance. We had a one bed room suite that had a private bedroom and bath. This unit also had a lovely living area with a pull out couch and another bath with a shower. We travelled with one teenager. When we checked in, we were given a smaller unit than we had been promised, but once we saw the room, we returned to the Front Desk and a new room was assigned with out any hesiation. Minor error ! Our room was on the 25th floor, a view to 7th Avenue... The room was very clean and well stocked for our purposes.Daily maid service, which you pay a small service fee for ,was well worth it. After staying at a high end hotel in NYC before, it was great to have a living space with a small kitchenette . We found a great wine shop around the corner on Broadway and there was a great PAX deli as well as a small supermarket ...We like to have Breakfast in our unit and this trip we found that after enjoying some fabulous lunches around the city, we did not want to eat another meal before the Theatre....Between PAX and the market( Morton and Williams) we were able to enjoy a lighter meal and rest before we headed out on the town again. Transportation around the city from this location is ideal...we liked to walk....and used the Double Decker tour bus to see more of the city. Would use the subway , but it was our daughter`s first trip and either City Sights or Gray LIne will give you Hop on Hop off tours to Manhattan and Brooklyn.Make sure you ask these tour operators for an extra day or 2 for the same price...always a deal in NYC. We did the theatre twice and most theatres were in walking distance. We always go directly to the Box Office for tickets as sometimes we get better seats at a better price....there is a discount ticket agent TKS in Time`s Square, but would rather not waste our New York Minutes waiting in line ups. We did not use the Lounge or the Fitness Center, however a number of guests we met were happy with the service. Elevators were not a big inconvenience, although I must admit they are a bit slow. Overall, we hope to return to The Manhattan Club.I do not think you can beat the location and the accommodations were better than we expected....and I admit I am a really picky when it comes to cleanliness...kudos to the housekeeping staff! I had read all the Horror stories about this hotel before we arrived and it was not part of our experience at all. To those going to visit soon, enjoy your stay and be thankful for the location and to those that are considering a trip, give it a try....New York is such a wonderful city to explore ...and The Manhattan Club is in the heart of it all

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable beds, nice hotel -- crummy hospitality fee”
Reviews.Author: HaveLadyWillTravel
Reviews.Content: It's all about location, location, location. Manhattan Club was a perfect location and in walking distance of almost everything we wanted to do. The one bedroom unit, which had 2 bathrooms, was perfect for a couple but would have been a little too crowded for 4 people. The beds were very comfortable and the unit was quiet. We have a great week in New York City. We did not like the fact that we paid upfront through RCI and through our time share, then Manhattan Club wants to tack on a "hospitality fee" of $25 per day. My definition of hospitality is entertaining guests or visitors with liberality and goodwill. So, now we have to pay people to be nice to us?? We had a great vacation and enjoyed the location. Would we go back, of course.

Reviews.Title: “worth waiting for”
Reviews.Author: davidleeds
Reviews.Content: It took a very long time but we were able to book an RCI exchange six months prior to our stay. From the sound of the agent at RCI it was like winning the lottery. They simply don't see space coming up at the Manhattan Club. I then spent the next six months reading alot of very bad reviews and was more than a little nervousl. Our visit was wonderful. I had phoned and requested a specific type of room and on arrival they said the room set aside for us wasn't ready but if I wanted another room very similar to what we booked we could have it. We chose to wait and went for a walk in Central Park which is about five minutes away. On return the room was ready . The one bedroom unit had two baths a kitchen and a living room with an eating area. There was more than ample storage including in the bathroom which is almost unheard of. The bed was great with fresh linens and a duvet. There was a door to close off the bedroom and one bath. There is no question that the room showed some wear and tear but not in any way that made us feel uncomfortable. There were lots of towels and supplies both in the bath and kitchen. The elevators worked very well. We never heard a sound from any other room. The staff was helpful and pleasant with one exception on checkout. I attempted to pay with travellers cheques and was told they don't accept them. The hotel would cash them but not accept them as payment. The young women was rude as well as unknowledgeable. I asked for the manager and she then phoned someone who told her they were accepted. The location is perfect for wakling and the subway. If you go out via the Park Central Hotel there is a subway about 30 seconds from the door. Buses run crosstown on 57th one block north. We did go to the presentation and were shocked at the cost to buy a timeshare unit. The manager who came out after the salespitch found it very hard to accept that we couldn't afford it. He did not like taking no for an answer. We loved Nocello for dinner which was good value and delicous. The theatre is so easy to get to by subway taking about 20 minutes max from door to door. I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Totally ruined our trip to NYC”
Reviews.Author: journeyman411
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write these types of reviews, in fact I think I've done this once in the past ten years, despite staying in hotels all over the world. But the experience at this place was, in a word, awful. The first night (which was a warm, humid evening in early November), the room felt quite warm as we went to bed. We adjusted the thermostat as low as it would go and turned in. By three a.m., we were all awake - the room was an oven. A call to the front desk informed us that this place had a "single pipe" system - hot or cold only. Due to it being early Nov, it was now heat only. We opened the door into the hallway - no relief. They told us to open the windows (16th floor, small kids in room...), which we did as much as safely possible. A fan was eventually delivered. When we asked for a second fan, we were told they were now out of them - others were presumably suffering this pressure cooker experience also. The second night things got far worse. We awoke to the sound of water dripping, fast and strong - the ceiling was leaking, dripping onto our sleeping children. The ceiling felt soggy, a weird rectangle appeared, like the panel might collapse down. A hotel "engineer" arrived. He agreed with my recommendation - we move rooms. At 3am, we carried our half-awake children and belongings to another room (no, it wasn't next door.) After two hours of lost sleep, we collapsed. The next morning, exhausted and red eyed, we discovered that this new room also had a leak - a badly leaking window (the saturated towel sitting on the sill when we arrived was the giveaway), and also, the shower leaked water to the point that literally 1/8" to 1/4" of water remained on the floor after use, noticeably rotting out the bottom of all furniture in the bathroom (obviously a long-term, unfixed problem). After we finally checked out, we were given the number of the Manhattan Club's Exec Director to ask for an adjustment to our bill. This man was something to behold. I mean, amazing, right out of a bad movie... not only unsympathetic (offering an apology only after being told we hadn't gotten one), but rude, arrogant and... he actually seemed to be enjoying himself being that way. Dripping with sarcasm over a speakerphone, shuffling papers loudly, he said it wasn't their policy to issue any credits, no matter what the circumstances, and that was "what made this country great - that we can disagree about this. You think you deserve some kind of credit, and I can say no." Yes, that's a direct quote. He confirmed that we had received the coupon for a free continental breakfast (Perhaps a $10 value, even in NYC - Bagels, carton juice etc.) And that was the end of that. And the end of any stays for us this "timeshare." In thinking back over this place, even setting aside our individual awful experience, it was a rotten core. Every time I rode the elevator in that 2 1/2 days, people commented on how long the line was to use the elevator in the lobby (there were never less than a dozen people in line - yes, actually in line, day and night) or how long they had waited on their floor for it (think ten minutes, not 2-3.) The lobby itself was a rush hour traffic jam of people and suitcases for the several hours around check in or check out. And even as we approached the front desk when we first arrived, the first thing we saw was a very angry/heated exchange between a guest and a manager. We should have known then. And now, you know. And have been warned...

Reviews.Title: “great time was had by all”
Reviews.Author: MattyWalter
Reviews.Content: We let our daughter and her husband stay at our time share and we stayed at a different location. Boy, were we sorry! They certainly got the better of the deal. They raved about the accommodations, the service, and the location for months afterwords. Next time we're giving them the "other" location and we're taking the Manhattan Club.

Reviews.Title: “Autumn in New York”
Reviews.Author: Yordy
Reviews.Content: We have been at the Manhattan Club for 2 weeks. Wonderful romantic view over Central Park, and therefor excellent location at midtown. The apt 1705 was on the corner of the buildind with 2 sides and 3 windows overlooking the 7th Av and the 56th Street. The apt was warm and cozy, two bathrooms, one bedroom, livingroom, and kitchenette. At the last floor there's a business center (free use of computers) and a big bar and common livingroom where you can find free newspapers and free cofee, tea, and biscuits from 11am to 4 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Club Suites aka Manhattan Time share Hotel 200 West 56th Street NY 100”
Reviews.Author: stargazer43
Reviews.Content: Well placed hotel undergoing change. We were offered timeshare whilst checking in! The 'remodelled rooms' are small but have above average decor. The main drawback is that many rooms face inwards into a central shaft that lets in barely any light so your room is in permanent darkness. If you stay at this hotel make sure you get an outward facing room. Staff range from helpful to inefficient and surly dependant on how busy they are. Lifts are programmed badly so you have to wait forever unless you are prepared to use the staircase. Not feasable for elderly or those with young children. Despite all this the hotel was crowded with out of town guests coming into NY for Christmas shopping and the shows. If you can get an outside facing room and resist the timeshare sales spiel it is worth staying here

Reviews.Title: “good location but disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: prdev
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here and upon arrival informed of 4pm check in which was fine and bags happily accommodated by concierge but when attempting to get to 23rd floor later with baggage had at least 10 mins wait to access the one working lift!! Long queue of people behind us becoming more and more frustrated. As the only lift working stopped at practically every floor on its way up and down it became really difficult to remain patient particularly by day 5 and the service lift was also out of action by now. We took to walking up/down several times before realising you could use the lift in the adjoining Park Central hotel from floor 11 down and back up to 23rd floor from their lobby. But no-one from the Manhattan Club informed us of this and seeing previous reports on this site I can now see it is an ongoing problem for the hotel and fail to understand why it has not been addressed before now. The room was ok but cold and the heating system was not working. A phone call to reception and we were informed an engineer would have to be called out! As we were now exhausted after flight we gave up waiting half hour later and went to bed. The bathroom was quite dated and the towels small and thin. No complimentary bottles of water but tea/coffee facilites and fridge and microwave in room. The only real advantage of this hotel was the location and the fact that we were out all day and came back to climb the stairs to fall asleep!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jonagh
Reviews.Content: I had read a lot of negative reviews about this hotel before I left but found it to be excellent! The staff were very friendly, it is 5 mins walk from times square and 4 of us (friends) shared a suite which had a lovely kitchen area, two double beds (one was sofa-but very comfortable and a lovely bathroom> We couldn't check in until 4 when we arrived but our bags were minded for us and a lovely local restaurant was recommended- we were also able to sit upstairs and enjoy complimentary tea/coffee/biscuits while we waited. The concierge was very helpful. a lot of people mentioned that the lifts were very slow but at the end of the day it was not a big deal. I would definitley recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevator, so what!”
Reviews.Author: got2gogolf
Reviews.Content: OK, so if you have an appointment, you've got to give yourself a little extra time with the elevators, which may or may not be working, but, wow, this place is so great for weekend visitors! It's on a pretty quiet street that's near theaters, museums, shopping and best of all Central Park! And our suite was just fabulous, with TWO BATHROOMS. And I can tell you, for two women weekending in NYC, this perk is worth a wait at the elevator! Friendly staff too. No restaurant, but I can recommend the Redeye Grill across the street and Trattoria Del Arte. Rooms have fridge and microwave too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and acceptable room”
Reviews.Author: Oshanda
Reviews.Content: In short - We stayed four nights at the Manhattan Club and overall found our Quad room comfortable (if a little on the small side) for our family of two adults and two children (6 and 7 year old boys). We chose the hotel because of price and location and it worked out well on both counts. In detail - when I first opened the door of our room I was taken back by how small it was. Then I remembered I was in New York! It had been 9 years since my last visit and I had forgotten how small the rooms in New York can be. The room was about standard for a New York hotel. We had what was called a "Quad" room. It consisted of a Queen size bed and a sofa bed. The sofa bed was just acceptable for our boys to sleep on. The mattress was so thin that an adult would have not slept due to the supporting frame of the mattress pushing into the middle of their back. Also, with the bed folded out the foot of the bed was too close too a glass topped coffee table for our liking - we felt it was awkward and dangerous. To solve this we took the glass top off and stored it under our bed and stood the coffee table on its end in a corner. In hindsight we should have asked the staff to remove the table. But the work around was fine. Other than the issues with the bed the room was completely fine. Our queen bed was quite comfortable and we slept well in it. Other guests have commented previously on the slowness of the lifts (elevators). We didn't have a problem with them, never more than a minute wait. I understand from one of the regular guests that the maintenance work on the lifts that had been going on for some time had been completed and that the accessibility of the lifts had improved significantly ever since. We did receive one call from hotel staff selling time share. They offered tickets to a show or a $150 Visa Cash card for attending one of their "60 to 90 minute presentations". But they weren't too pushy about it and when I explained that we didn't visit often and hadn't been to New York for 9 years they backed right off and we did not hear from them again during our stay. We also found a couple of great, reasonably priced restaurants near our hotel. We had great pizza on 57th street and also went to a lovely asian restaurant on 7th avenue called Lili's that did Chinese food and Sushi. The real winner for us was the location. Being close to the subway and Central Park and a few minutes stroll to 5th Avenue and Times Square made this a great place to be based. When our boys had enough of the city we just wandered up to Central Park so they could run around and let off steam ,

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Club Great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler477
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club is in a great location. 3 blocks from Central Park. Easy subway access, Close to Time Square and many other NYC attractions. Lots of restraunts nearby. Very helpful staff. the one bedroom suite has 2 full bathrooms which worked out nice for 2 couples. the fold out bed was not comfortable and we took the mattress out of the couch and put it on the floor to make it more comfortable. The kitchen does not have a stove. Overall we had a great stay and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't worth the money we saved”
Reviews.Author: UtahSpaBaby
Reviews.Content: We used RCI points, so our stay for a week was about $85. It was not worth the savings. I would easily spend $500 a night for a better place. There weren't enough elevators to for the number of guests they had. There are no amenities at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Manhatten Club in a SCAM- Prospective Timeshare Buyer, BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: US-Euro-Traveler
Reviews.Content: We have been a Timeshare owners at the Manhattan Club for over seven years now and we very much regrate ever doing business with this SCAM that called the Manhattan Club. When we joined they were very nice to us. The fee for the week we owned was about $600 and they told us that we own a suit for a certain week of the year we can change it to any week we desired. We have also been told that the week of this Unit we own is Flexible and as owners we are entitled to change our week to any 7 consecutive or non-consecutive nights at our option, and including 3 weekend stays par year. By now The weekly rate jamped to over $2,000 (more than tripled) which we have to pay at the begining of the year but we COULD NEVER GET A WEEK OR EVEN SOME DAYS. FORGET ABOUT WEEKENDS. They keep saying it is all booked for any week or even days we requests BUT WHEN WE CALLED THIER OFFICE IN PHILADELPHIA WE COULD GET THE SAME WEEK THEY HAVE TOLD US WAS TOTTALY BOOKED IF WE WOULD PAY THE RIGHT PRICE. We have purchased our unit because the location was good and still is but, when we did manage to get a room for a couple of days 3 years ago we found out that the service that used to be fair turned to be almost unbearable, the front dask agents are rude and impatience and the stay was no fun. We could get over the bad service because of the location but, we are tierd of bagging and being TURNED DOWN for a week that we paid a lot of money for and we CAN NEVER receive. POTANTIAL TIMESHARE BUYER AT THE MANHATTEN CLUB, BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Already paid in full but no room when arrive”
Reviews.Author: BKKAngel
Reviews.Content: I contacted the reservation dept. of the property. Firstly, it seemed nice and professional. I understood that the Manhattan Club is a time share property. I was asked to attend the sales presentation and I ageed. I was also asked for the credit card no. only for "GUARANTEE" the book. I did specifically mentioned that I will pay by cash - so the please do not charge on my card. This is due to the exchange rate matter. After I agreed on the booking, then the problems started. 1. Changing of the contact person I once tried to contact the same representative for the booking as to change my staying date. I waited for a week before he contacted me back with the message that he only in charge of the booking. I do need to contact another department. 2. My card was charged in full. I specifically mentioned that it was for "Guarantee" of the booking only, not to be charge. So I have to pay about USD 100 more due to the exchange rate and the bank charge. 3. No room when arrived When I and the family arrived at the property at 1 am (after a 27 hour-flight), the staff told us that there was no room for us for tonight. He didn't know the cause but he was asked to put us on another hotel nearby for a night. The room should be ready first thing in the morning. I was also suggested to file a complaint with the director who would be in the office tomorow in the morning. I asked the staff if the hotel he put us in was in the equivalent rate we paid. He said "Yes". When we arrived at the hotel, we asked for the rate. It was USD 199, but we paid for USD 285. - How equivalent is that? 3.1 When I came back in the in the morning (9.00 am), the director was not in yet. So, I decided to attend the presentation firstly by asking the front desk staff to inform me once the director is in. But until we finished with the presentation (11.00 am), there was no one informing us at all. 3.2 When I contacted the front desk again, I was treated with neglecting behavior. There were 3 staffs behind the counter and they were snobbish and hostile. a) I asked for the director and the answer I got was that the director was in the meeting. b) I asked what time the meeting will end. The reply was in the afternoon. c) I asked if they could inform the director that there was a client waiting to see him because I had appointments in the afternoon. They refused to do so. d) I asked for my room. They said the check-in time is 4.00 pm. I was so upset because this vacation was for my mom's birthday. I had plans in the afternoon and couldn't wait the whole day for this mess. I started to piss off. The staff traited me to lower my voice or they would call the police. I, then, asked them to call the police. I called my lawyer. The police didn't come but the Chief of the Security came to talk with me. She informed me that the director was not working today. (I was surprise with the 3rd different messege I received about the director - so who's the [--].) And the room wouldn't be ready until 4. I said nevermind I already called lawyer. He would be here in a minute. After my lawyer arrived at 12.00 pm, he had a conversation with the same staffs. I got the room immediately with the complimented 1 day continental breakfast for 2 and the reimbursement for my 1st night at the cheaper hotel. I was once a New Yorker. I didn't expect this to be happening in one of my beloved city. Thanks to my friend who is a lawyer, otherwise, we would have been treated as a group of stupid asians who doesn't know anything. However, there was a nice thing. The guard who was asked to watch over me. He has more service mind than the front office staff. He should be promoted to replace them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, though I wouldn't buy”
Reviews.Author: georgelovesbosco
Reviews.Content: We had been contacted directly from the facility every 3 months for the past 4 years inviting our family to come stay at a reduced rate and take a "no pressure" tour of the facility. Being a native New Yorker, I am very familiar with the city. The location is as convienent as any in the city. The concierge was able to get us the theater tickets and restaurant reservations we requested that I was unable to do so directly myself. The 1 bedroom, 2 full bath room was spacious for Manhattan. The 26th floor lounge was large, friendly bar tender but only a few people there late night. The elevator efficieny was poor, average wait 5 minutes, faster using the 2 service elevators. The only disappointment we experienced was the we went for our "90 minute tour / presentation" before we checked in. We were expected to make a decision on the purchase right there even before we checked into our room. I found the finance "money man" was as pushy and arrogant as they come and this is coming from myself a native new yorker now living 3 hrs away. The "special deal" of $10 grand off was only good for those 90 minutes, if the place is so popular, why would they need to put a gun to our heads with this type of pressure sale. I responded that I did not intend to make that type of committment without "driving the car first". They responded that this should be a no brainer, and it was we declinded their offer. At that time they became as cold as you could imagine. I was also told originally that I was paying for a 1 bedroom suite however on the initial check in they said they only had a studio and would see what they could do. They gave the impression that they were setting us up to see if we would buy before making the room committment. However, after declining to purchase, to my suprise we did get the 1 bedroom. Honestly speaking, if we took the tour at the end of our stay and if they were not so NY pushy, we may have purchased a week. They should rethink their strategy. Hopefully this helpful to others A New York Native, living in a small country college town for the past 20 yrs (the best of both worlds)

Reviews.Title: “no real problems”
Reviews.Author: MattieMattie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Manhattan Club with my Husband,30 yr old daughter and 13yr old granddaughter. we were there 7-4-08 to 7-11-08. Our check in was wonderful,the girl at the front desk could not have been nicer ,we exchanged though RCI and checked in at 3:30pm. Our room was 1708 and was very,very clean. It had a mini kitchen,two baths with tubs,a living room with pull out (which my daughter and granddaughter found ok to sleep on)we had a king bed in the bedroom that was very comfy. The maids came in every day for a fee of $25.00 per day but worth it. We rode the subway most of the time. We did take a taxi when we went to a show or out for the night . It was very warm and one would be too sweaty to walk to the theatre area. Location is great and there are little markets to get prepared foods, snacks or food items.There is a small fridge & microwave in the unit. We had two TV's and a table to sit at to eat. The elevators were slow and we did take the service elevators at times but the wait was not that long. The staff helped with anything that we wanted with a smile and in a timely manner. We did not see anyone that was rude or did not want to be helpful from the maids,desk staff to the door men. We would stay here anytime we can. It was a wonderful week.

Reviews.Title: “Great place but the service level was shocking”
Reviews.Author: Susan018
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manhattan Club for 7 days. Location was great as was the room/studio unit. In general we had a great stay but it was marred by the rudeness of the staff who were rather condescending and abrupt - in particular one of females working at the reception area was so rude that her manner bordered on insolence. We would recommend staying at the Manhattan Club as it is in a great location, easily accessible, clean, rooms are great and well maintained however we would warn people to expect rudeness from the staff . MDC - South Africa - August 2008

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: senorak
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week long stay at the Manhattan Club (timeshare exchange via RCI). I was a bit nervous before our stay, after reading many of the reports here, however, we didn't have many of the problems that others experienced. The wait for elevators ranged from no time at all to 5-10 minutes. Longest waits were the days of check in/out on the weekends. Most waits were less than 3 minutes. Our 1 bedroom/ 2 bath unit was one of the smallest I have stayed in at the MC, but even with 5 people, we had room. The king sized bed was huge, and while not a lot of drawer space, we hung most of our clothes in the closet, or placed them on the high shelf in the closet. The desk in the bedroom provided a nice area to check email and search the internet for restaurants in the city. The internet connection was free, but at times, it was "iffy". The living room was a nice size.....all of us could fit to watch TV in the evening. It became crowded once we opened the sofa bed (sister and her child slept in that), The two bathrooms were large, and came in handy w/ 5 people getting ready in the morning. We had plenty of towels, (think they gave 6 of each), as well as bath products, which were replenished daily if needed. The mini kitchen was very limited.....just a microwave to do any cooking, along with a small coffee pot (less than 4 cups), and a small fridge. Coffee, tea, and popcorn was replenished each day. There were enough plates/glasses (6 of each, in varying sizes) for everyone, as well as silverware. Some cabinet space to store snacks. Can't beat the location....subways are around the corner and across the street. Starbucks around the corner, full service grocery store within 2 blocks, and a large "Whole Foods" store in the Time Warner building (several blocks away). Plenty of restaurants/pubs in every price range within a short walk. Kids loved spending time in Central Park, at the playgrounds and climbing the huge rocks. We did the typical touring, saw some shows, and visited museums. Everyone had a great time.....and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you have patience and don't need a full service hotel”
Reviews.Author: rcs249
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous after reading the reviews, but pleasantly surprised during my stay this month. Starting with the cons: 1) The elevators! We were on the 16th floor and at times just walked down! There was 1 regular elevator and then the service elevators, so we waited from 2-10 minutes based upon time of day. 2) While pleasant, housekeeping was very slow in helping us out our first night with a small issue, but then were fine after that. 3) The concierge was adequate but not particularly helpful. 4) The pullout couch, which my daughters slept on, was awful, so they put the mattress on the floor and layers of blankets on it to deal with the thin covering over the innersprings. Now the pros: 1) Great location just 3 short blocks from Central Park, 10 minutes to Rockefeller Center and 5th Ave shops, diagonally across the street from Carnegie Hall, and the theatres were all within a 5-15 minute walking distance (there are so many sets of lights that it can take a while). 2) The room was a generously sized 1 bedroom corner with views of Central Park, which I loved. 3) The bed was surprizingly comfortable. 4) Two great bathrooms! 5) Despite sweltering 88-92 degree weather, the ACs worked beautifully! So in summary, great location, great room, be careful of the pull-out couch mattresses and hope that both elevators are in service when you go, but I wouldn't hesitate to return!

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Club has gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: shanebrook
Reviews.Content: We are timeshare owners at the Manhattan Club and have been so since 2005. We stay here all the time when we come to NYC. We love the Manhattan Club and have no intention of selling our timeshare (we use it so much). However, it has gone downhill since we first began coming here: PROBLEMS: --Service is spotty at bets. Can be good. Can be terrible (unresponsive). However, we have never had rude service. --ELEVATORS!!!! Be prepared to wait a LONG time to catch an elevator. Usually only one (of two) elevator works so they open up the service elevators (which don't help much). STRENGTHS: --Nice clean rooms (usually). --LOCATION!!! You can't beat the location. Close to Time Square and Central Park. This is a nice place to stay. It isn't what it used to be which is a management problem. They need someone who can figure out how to run a timeshare hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: kwalshyork1
Reviews.Content: I was invited to stay here for a package deal to tour the property and check out ownership. Check-in started fine- I was able to check in early and get situated before i went on my tour. After that- here are all of the things that went wrong: 1. The TV in the room didn't work. We had to ask several people to come and check it before it would function. 2. I had to call several times for new towels. 3. The elevator never came to Floor 2. If staff saw you waiting, they would yell at you to take the service elevators where you had to share the elevator with trash bins and garbage. 4. The concierge was rude. When I asked her what there was to do around the hotel she said, "Didn't you do your homework?" I had to push her to give me specific suggestions. 5. The "Executive Level" boasts a Continental Breakfast and Lounge Service. You have to pay for both. 6. I was overcharged by $700 for my stay. When I went to complain, I was still overcharged by $100. I had to call the original booking company to get it fixed. 7. I valet parked and gave my credit card. No one told me you had to request to be billed for your car so when my car came I was yelled at that I was trying to get away without paying. When I asked the Valet how to get to the Lincoln Tunnel, he said, "I have no idea" On the positive side- the location is great. It is walking distance to Central Park, 5th Ave and Times Square. The restaurant across the street, the Red Eagle is wonderful. I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Garbish”
Reviews.Author: Salokin1980
Reviews.Content: If you like being told lies and treated like rubbish then this is the place for you ! If like any sane and normal person you dont, then give this place a miss.....even if there is a hooters bar over the road !! I have never been treated so badly in all my life than by this place. Keep your eyes peeled for Antonio Munoz (Assistant Front Desk Manager), he's the star performer in this shambolic performance. I can also back up what everybody else says about the elevators. I bet I'm not the only person on here to experience "plumbing difficulties"...... Don't stay here or it'll tarnish your experience of this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Manhattan Club was Good”
Reviews.Author: GarySeattleWA
Reviews.Content: It amazes me how the ratings for this resort vary. I stayed from May 3 to May 10, 2008. I think the rooms are great. I would rate this resort 3.5 stars. It could easily be 4 or 5 if they refurbished the rooms. Since TripAdvisor only has whole stars and I really enjoyed my stay, I gave it a 4. I got the room through RCI. The park is only 3 blocks away and Carnagie Hall is across the street. GREAT LOCATION! At W 57th and 7th Ave, you are in the middle of the hustle and bustle of New York. I had room 2219. It is a corner "Executive Studio" unit so I had 2 windows with a view of Central Park. Nice! My room was very funtional and a great place to relax after walking all day in the city. I don't understand folks that complain about noise in New York. That is part of the experience! If the windows are open, it is noisy. Cole Porter says it best: "I happen to like New York, I happen to like this town. I like the city air, I like to drink of it, The more I know New York the more I think of it. I like the sight and the sound and even the stink of it. I happen to like New York." The rooms do need to be updated. While my room was very clean, the soft goods are showing wear and tear. Faded bed spread, spots on fabric chair/couch, wear and tear, etc. Just needs to be updated. The carpet looked new and the flat screen TV was nice. Air conditioning worked great. The small refirgerator worked but it was too cold. On the lowest setting, it would freeze my soft drinks. Had great cola slurpies. I let them know when I checked out. Elevator Issue RESOLVED: They completely replaced an entire elevator car. For half of my stay there was only one lobby elevator. They did allow you to use the freight elevator but I didn't like it. They opened up the new elevator so both elevators are in service. The new one is very nice. Yea! All of the major subway lines are very close. Very convenient for getting around the city. I recoomend buying a multi day subway pass. I bought a $25 7 days pass which was a really good value as I traveled all over the city. Tip: Get a "City Pass" if you plan to visit the museums and tourist attractions. It was great because you bypass many of the ticket purchase lines at the attractions. It also will save you a ton of money. I bought mine at the 3 hour around Manhattan Island Cirlcle Line cruise. Very interesting. Check it out at www.citypass.com. We saw Wicked and The Lion King. Great shows. These are still not available at TKTS (half price tickets) due to still being so popular. The hotel staff were helpful and courteous. They are New Yorkers however. I think some folks that review here don't understand New York culture. It is fast and succinct. This is not a slow paced Carribean resort. I would definately return to The Manhattan Club. If they refurbish the rooms I would even consider becoming an owner. Good times to be had at the Manhattan Club. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Hated Manhattan Club!!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerforlife
Reviews.Content: Only one elevator was running for guests. The back 2 service levators were opened for guests but we had to go up and down with the help, the garbage and the laundry. Long waits at the elevators. Very poor customer service. Bad management. Front Desk Staff very rude and not very helpful. Lots of banging outside the hotel windows. Would not buy timeshare here and would never stay here again! Beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value for the money and great location!......”
Reviews.Author: David1958
Reviews.Content: We booked direct from the UK. After reading the reviews on here, we were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Points to note: The Manhattan Club is a timeshare complex (NO sales pressure) and as such has very liitle in in the way of amenites. The concierge desk people are not particulary pleasant to talk to and give an impression of being unhelpful.The lifts are not all working, so be prepared to wait for typically up to 3-4 minutes. No real problem for us. The rooms are clean and comfortable (two bathrooms), but are beginning to look a littele-bit dated, The location is first-class, Times Square and Central Park, all easily within walking distance. Everything is almost on your doorstep and there's even an Irish Pub across the road which shows all the live premiership football (bliss). The rooms facing the front of the hotel can be a bit traffic noisy, but conversly the rooms at the side are next to buliding development works. This is definitely not the prettiest place to stay, but overall, you really would have to go some to beat it on value for money and location!! I am glad we picked this place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and room if you go at the right time of year”
Reviews.Author: mcm15
Reviews.Content: I own several timeshares and rented a one-bedroom suite with two bathrooms from an owner at Manhattan Club. RCI is the timeshare company for all suites except the penthouse suites, which is affiliated with Interval International timeshare management. This is a great property on West 56th and 7th Ave.-near Carnegie Hall, across from Redeye Grill. Easy walk to small grocery and Duane Reed pharmacy/sundry stores. I stayed here before in a studio suite, which is okay for a couple but crowded if you bring a grandchild. The one bedroom suite with 2 baths is large for NYC with nice kitchenette, dining table with 4 chairs. Plenty of dresser drawers and two closets. Best king sized bed I have ever had in a hotel,too. The sheets had several large tears in them but were soft. Only problems were: 1. The elevators are very slow and crowded. Take your chance at the lobby elevator or the service elevator and hope for the best.When we were there, one of the lobby elevators was out of service for "improvements". A staff member told us the improvements would make the elevator nicer but would have no affect on speed - too bad! 2. Climate control can be a problem depending on time of year. We stayed in April and the rooms were VERY hot. You can open the windows but we had a room facing another building and ventilation was not great even when we had all four windows open. The temperature outside was between 48 and 62 F. We requested a fan but were told all of the fans were loaned out already for each day of our 3 night stay. We requested a fan twice a day for 3 days with no luck, although everyone was very polite. Why not put two fans in each room? It would have made our stay so much more comfortable. Management and the bell man told us they were not required to turn the air condioner on until late May. They said since this is a very old building there are only two pipes instead of four, which means they could turn on heat for the cooler months and A/C for the warmer months but never a choice of heat or A/C at all times. Everyone in the building was complaining of being too hot. We were considering purchasing a timeshare here, but the lack of individual climate control changed our minds. I would stay here only in December through March (good bet for the heater to be on) or June-August (good bet for the a/c to be on). The housekeeping was excellent, bathrooms were clean and of adequate size. Only complaint in bathroom is that there is a pedestal sink and absolutely no cabinet or stand to put toiletries. No hook on back of bathroom door to hold a hanging toiletry case either. Two nice terry robes were provided but only one hook in the small bath on the wall to hang one robe. The kitchenette had microwave,coffeemaker,small refrigerator, dishwasher, sink and small supply of dishes,bowls,plates and utencils.Maid service was provided daily (unusual for a timeshare) and soundproofing is good between rooms. If you close the windows, you hear minimal Manhattan street noise like horns and sirens. We ended up leaving all windows open to keep the room cooler. We were awakened by construction noise which we assumed were related to sandblasting since sand started coming through the opened windows on two mornings of our 3 night stay. We had to close the windows and leave until later in the day. There is a nice exercise room and business center, along with an owner's lounge on the 26th floor. Wireless internet was free and worked well in our suite. The "Penthouse suites" have access to owners or their guests by a key in the elevator on the 26th floor. I don't know if there are similar climate control problems but there are two terraces (north and south) with lovely views. Only problem is the very loud air handlers on the roof near both terraces that make conversation difficult due to noise. I would stay again but only during months when heat or A/C would be on.

Reviews.Title: “Elevators are a HUGE problem.”
Reviews.Author: JD3
Reviews.Content: We recently enjoyed a 3 night stay here.We had a 1 BR unit with a King bed, and the kids slept on a pullout in the living room. Both rooms were a really good size, especially for NYC, and there was lots of storage space. There were 2 full baths. One had a tub/shower combo, and the other had a large shower. Bath and Body works soaps/shampoos/lotions were included. The kitchenette area had a table and 4 chairs, microwave, frig., dishes, and dishwasher.There was also a coffeemaker and included coffee We enjoyed being able to have our coffee and breakfast in each morning. A major problem with this hotel/timeshare is the elevators. There are only 2 that serviced the timeshare apts., and 2 service elevators. Since 1 elevator was out of service,guests could use the service elevators, but it took FOREVER to get down from the 17th floor. We waited 40 minutes once, as every time one stopped, it was jammed full Finally we squeezed onto an elevator going up, and we stopped on each of the floors up until the 26th floor, and then on each floor on the way down.Everytime the door opened there were people hoping to get on, but there was no way. Everyone was complaining, and it was a huge problem! One couple squeezed their 2 kids on with us, and they walked down 17 flights to meet us at the bottom. Guess who got there 1st! Other than that, our stay was great..

Reviews.Title: “NYC at its best!”
Reviews.Author: jmcgolf
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Manhattan Club...we completely enjoyed it (in spite of the negative reviews we had read, we were a little concerned, then were pleasantly surprised. The MC exceeded our expectations.) Great accommodations, close to everything (Broadway, Central Park, 5th Avenue, Times Square, restaurants) and we found the entire staff to be very polite and friendly! The elevators are under renovation (like many buildings in NYC, the building is very old, thus the elevators are being updated)....just be patient. When you visit, do ask the staff for restaurant recommendations to avoid potential tourist traps - and do expect to pay a little more - you are in Manhattan! To get half-priced broadway tickets, be sure to visit the TKTS booth in Times Square. To get around, buy a Metro Card and use the subway - very efficient and seemed safe. In fact, the city in general felt much safer than we expected. We are already looking forward to our next stay at The MC and highly recommend it to others. Can't imagine staying anywhere else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “beware of the manhatan club”
Reviews.Author: timesharequeenNyc
Reviews.Content: this is my 3 time staying at manhattan club the first one before the renovations which was unbelivabley dissapointing as i could not watch tv comforably in the room due the angle of the bed and the t.v. i stayed for a few days in january and the suites are designed nice and the engineer showed me how to operate the dvd player with the hi def tv. you had to ask for a dvd player why they are not standard in the room i dont know. i came back for a few more days as i had expiring points and the tv in one room did not work. my room was changed as i asked to have the dvd/vcr combo brought to my new room and i was told that it was not compatible with the t.v. but it was hooked up to the previous room tv which was defective . then i asked for a plain dvd player and i was told that no dvd players are compatible with the t.v. i told the engineer that i was here 2 weeks ago in the same room with a dvd player which worked and he told me no .the staff acts like you are disturbing them when you ask for something. the location of the building is the only positive thing here. the are so many hotels in n.y. where staff actually smiles when you come in and greets you. the light switches in my room were missing in most of the rooms so i had to leave the bathroom lights on otherwise there was no light in the room. ther is no bathroom bar for the tub and the whole bathroom is marble so it is dangeous for elderly people. this place is toutee as one of the most difficult timeshare exchanges there is so i expected much more from this place since it had been renovated.you also have to pay a per night housekeeping fee .personally i will stay at an affinia hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I lived nearer!”
Reviews.Author: Kazza45
Reviews.Content: Stayed here through RCI timeshare exchange for 7 nights in Sept 2007. Was a bit worried about mixed reviews of accommodation but all I can say is that it was fabulous. We had a 1 bed suite with 2 bathrooms, lounge area with kitchenette and separate bedroom with king size bed. Room was at rear of hotel so rather dark and no view but who goes to NY to look out of the window? Location on 56 St is amazing, so close to all attractions. Daily Maid service @$25 per night was well worth it. I would go back time and again if I didn't live so far away Karen

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravilinMom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults and 2 small children visited New York for the first time. We spent 7 nights in a 1 bedroom unit at this Timeshare/Hotel property. It was fantastic overall. By New York standards, the unit was very good size, including 2 full bathrooms, bedroom, a living room with eating area and a kitchenette, which ended up being our saving grace. There was a refrig., microwave, dishwasher, coffee pot and dishes. We were out walking and seeing from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm each day and it was wonderful to be able to pick up some fresh ready made food from the many markets/food bars in the neighborhood and go back to our room to eat, (instead of dragging 2 tired youngsters to a restaurant) relax, make some hot tea and really rejuvinate for the next day. The unit was clean, quiet and very comfortable. The front desk staff was not particularly friendly, but we had no specific issues with them. The Housekeeping and maintainance staff was great. (the guests in the unit next door left their bathtub running and it flooded our front hall closet). The best part about this property was its location. 2 blocks from the southern edge of Central Park - there was a subway station right downstairs - and only 15 min. walk to Broadway ! We loved this place and will definately be back to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I love NYC”
Reviews.Author: vosl
Reviews.Content: Having never been to NYC before I had no idea where we were staying but we could not have been in a better location. If you walk out the front door to your left is Broadway and to your right is Carnegie Hall, 2 Blocks and you are at Central Park. Times Square is nearby. There are subways close by to transfer you to downtown but we found we walked everywhere most of the time. We had a 1 bedroom unit with 1.7 bathrooms. This means the 2nd bathroom does not have a shower. We had 5 adults stay in the apartment. We had rung and requested a roll away prior to our arrival but it was not in the room when we arrived so my husband went down to the front desk and the roll away was delivered within minutes! Even with the rollaway we had plenty of space for all of us and our 10 bags!! (This was the last stop on a 6 week holiday.) The rooms were kept very clean when we were there but some of the plates in the cupboard were dirty when we arrived. The Club has a recently upgraded gym and the owners lounge looked extremely comfortable but we never spent time there. We did however spend time in the office with free internet access. Having this onsite was very helpful, instead of trying to find internet cafes , the right change etc at locations off site. We found this a very well equipped and high standard of accommodation. Though the lifts are annoying Would definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a busy weekend in NYC”
Reviews.Author: travelmadgal
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Manhattan Club with 4 other girls while on a long weekend shopping in New York in December. I was very impressed with the apartment and with the location and would not hesitate to recommend it. We had a one bedroom apartment - with 2 bathrooms which was an unexpected bonus. The sofa bed was not great but most sofa beds are pretty poor - we were so tired after long days shopping we slept well anyway. I've seen a lot of complaints about the slow elevators. We used the service elevators near the reception desk during our stay - there was a sign beside the desk advising guests that there were additional elevators. It meant that sometimes we were sharing the elevator with the laundry or squeezing in with all the housekeeping staff â€“ but nobody minded. We never saw any other guests using them â€“ but you should! It saved lots of time. There is great diner nearby - we had dinner there and were very impressed by the food and service - Brooklyn Diner 212 West 57th Street (between Broadway and 7th Ave.) We go to New York every year shopping and will definitely be staying in the Manhattan Club again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: geligam
Reviews.Content: Perfectly good. No complaints. Huge rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: DRPEPPERSSON
Reviews.Content: Awesome place. Great location. Fridge and microwave make it perfect. I love this place. Will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Suite And No Car Needed”
Reviews.Author: conkyebay
Reviews.Content: FANTASTIC LOCATION - multiple subway entries close and absolutely no need for a car. A few blocks from Central Park, across the street from Carnegie Hall and few blocks from the main shopping streets. The staff was really helpful and quick. The accommodations were spotlessly clean, spacious, and cleaned well daily. Only downside was waiting at times for the elevator, but the suite itself makes up for it. I will stay there again whenever I can book it.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than most reviews.”
Reviews.Author: rbkmrosen
Reviews.Content: I am compelled to write since there are many negative reviews of the Manhattan Club. I have stayed in at least 10 other hotels in NY and in my opinion this is one of the best. A family of four, we had a one bedroom suite with 1 3/4 baths. It had a nice size bedroom and the sitting area/kitchen was large enough to contain the open sleeper sofa and a twin air bed without any problems. The condition of the room was excellent, and we had no complaints about the cleanliness. Compared to most NY hotel rooms we have stayed, this is definitely one of the nicest and surely the largest. To address issues of other reviewers: We did not find the elevators particularly slow--only once did we feel the wait was greater than 3 to 4 minutes. The hotel invites patrons to use the service elevators and they can be quicker. The hotel has studios and one bedroom suites. The studios appear per other reviewers to be too small for 4 people. The one bedrooms are not and that may explain some of the poorer reviews. We did not find the staff to be unfriendly or rude. They did not try to be our friends, but they did their jobs adequately. The only negatives we encountered were the air conditioning system which was a bit weak, and difficulty accessing the wireless internet. The AC problem was solved in Nov. by opening the windows an inch. It took several phone calls to the front desk to get the long-on name to be able to access the free wireless internet; and the concierge had no idea how to get online. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...but”
Reviews.Author: CoopVirginia
Reviews.Content: After being contacted almost weekly for months by the marketing department we decided to give it a try. We arrived early and our bags were Totally unimpressed with the suites and the price. When we indicated that we were not interested we were asked "why did you come"? Well you called us weekly for months and you offered Broadway tickets plus some was our answer. Clearly the "top seller" was not happy with us. Was actually somewhat rude after learning our decision. Anyway the perks were great. Got to see Phantom of the Opera, Central Park and everything else within walking and subway(first time to NYC) The room was small and rather drab. The elevators were dreadfully slow. Would not recommend unless a fantastic deal can be obtained. Location is great.

Reviews.Title: “liked the manhattan”
Reviews.Author: shamrockIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week with my wife and 2 teenagers,the location is great its a short walk to times square, its beside central park ,the hotel was clean enough,the staff were friendly ,the only problem was that we booked a quad room (the biggest available)which we presume would have consisted of a double bed an 2 singles beds,what we got was a double bed and a sofa bed shoehorned into 1 room which made it a very crowded few days! Its a nice hotel if you go without children,but be wary of the phonecalls home,we were charged 250 dollars for 8 short calls to ireland .

Reviews.Title: “Good location but....!”
Reviews.Author: AmelieIreland
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Manhattan Club Hotel. Dislikes: The reception staff were not overly friendly. A genuine smile would help! The room was not adequate for 4 people, as it had only one double bed & one double sofa bed to accommodate us. The extractor fan in the bathroom was not working & when we phoned reception, we were told the fan wasn't working. No suggestion given as to when or if it would be fixed. The elevators were very slow and too small. Likes: Good location. Short walk from Central Park & excellent diners. Bellboys (except for one) and the concierge were very friendly & helpful. One of the chambermaids we met was very friendly & had a genuine pleasant smile. The kitchenette was a bonus, with cutlery & plates etc supplied. The beds, while inadequate, were comfortable & the kitchenette, & bathroom were spotlessly clean. Loved New York. Will be back again but not to the Manhattan Club!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: MasseyLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a treat for my daughters 13th Birthday and we had a great time. Room was spotlessly clean, good view outside and we had no trouble with the lifts! Staff I would say were polite but not as freindly as other people we met. Although when I had a problem (not to do with the hotel)the Manager was very efficient in sorting it out speedily for me. The location and standard of the room/suite means we would happily reccommend this hotel. One tip, book express passes for Empire State Buliding, well worth the extra cost, you get treated like royalty and we were up to the 86th floor within 5 minutes of entering the building, by passing massive queues. Fab delux deli around the corner and Central Park 5 minutes away, as is 5th Avenue. At the Rockerfeller Centre try the Rainbow Room for cocktails with its fab views. It is walking distance and well worth the mortgage busting cost!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: SafariToStay
Reviews.Content: Wife and I recently (Oct 2007) stayed at the MC. Great value during the week. Nice sized room with modern bath, flatscreen TV with lots of cable channels, 2 wardrobe closets. Great location, across from Carnegie Hall, a couple of blocks from Central Park South, walking distance to braodway theaters. great restaruant (Red Eye) across the street, Carnegie deli around the corner, 2 blocks from 5th Ave shopping. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: entucasa
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed at this hotel, which is in an excellent location. I read a lot of bad reviews about it prior to going, but was more than pleasantly surprised at how nice it was. The room was well furnished, very clean and comfortable. Booked as a package & not as a time share exchange, the check in took less than 5 minutes. I did note that there was chaos on a Sunday check in, which looked like they were all time share guests. I have to admit that the reception staff were not as friendly as in other hotels I have stayed in, but nor were they rude. I would most definitely stay there again. S.S. Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: winnie15
Reviews.Content: Stayed at his hotel in September, had booked a one bedroom suit and was given a studio apartment, but as there was three adults and one being my stepson who is 19 it was abit embarrassing when getting ready, Location good but hats about it. Staff unfriendly and not helpful what so ever.. Would not recommend this hotel to anyone, stay in a neighboring hotel around the same area.. Rooms and windows could do with a good clean room smelt musty. Really enjoyed the holiday and weather was lovely, but would stay some where else next time. I hope these reviews are read so they can make it better.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable well-located hotel in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Oakland-traveler
Reviews.Content: The Manhattan Club was better than we had expected after reading TripAdvisor reviews. We stayed in one of their newly renovated Metropolitan Suites on the second floor. Though the room was small, everything was clean and new. A small kitchenette area with a microwave,sink and refrigerator was a plus. The bathroom was modern and a reasonable size. The bed was excellent. The elevators ARE slow, but not impossibly so. (We walked from the main floor using service stairs, but one of our party was on the 15th floor.) The staff at the front desk and concierge desk were consistently pleasant and helpful. Overall, given the extremely high prices of midtown hotels, this was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DELORESSIMMS
Reviews.Content: We just got back for a 4-day stay at the Manhattan Club. It was an ideal location, our junior suite was clean, nicely furnished and larger than most accommodations in NYC. The only negative comment we have is that they let no one check in before 4:00 P.M. Suddenly at 4:00 P.M., all the rooms were ready. We got caught in a terrible rain downpour and were soaked by the time we arrived at The Manhattan Club at 2:00 P.M. we kept checking to see if we could get into our room to change into dry clothes: however, that was not going to happen. We did not let this spoil our stay. The accommodations were excellent. I would not hesitate to stay there again. The Simms Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Small But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dbacon
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the MANHATTEN CLUB in early July and we had a very nice time, Rooms were a little on the small side if for four people (JR SUITE) But for us it was fine. They say FIRST IMPRESSIONS LAST and having worked in the industry myself and at the front desk, It was a disappointment to find that most of the REVIEWS I READ about this place before we arrived were true regarding the RECEPTIONIST STAFF. There were no smiles and even a little small talk can go along way to someone when they first arrive in a new place, I just couldn't believe how unfriendly they all seemed to be. Thankfully the rest of the staff made up for it. The BELLBOYS are very nice, I'm sorry now i didn't write down there names, but they're great. Tthe CHAMBERMAID was the CLUBS BIGGEST ASSET very nice and very friendly. I was always brought up to believe that a smile doesn't cost you a thing but a frown can cost you the earth. I'm afraid the reception staff in the place are costing it the world and if i were the boss here it would be the one thing i would SORT OUT, BIG TIME!!!! All that aside it is a great location, close to all the usual things to ee and do and we will go back. NEW YORK is a geat city and i'm glad to say I found it to be a very safe place to be.. Don't be afraid to do your own thing and if in any difficulty just ask one of the street vendors, They are very good and seem to know the city better than most. If in a hurry or only there for a couple of days get the day pass on the subway ($7.00 AND KIDS GO FREE) and get on and off all over the city as you please. Hope all who read this and go, have as nice a time AS MY SON AND I HAD.

Reviews.Title: “Great Short Getaway”
Reviews.Author: denlyd
Reviews.Content: As has been previously stated, The location is great. The employees were friendly and helpful Good size unit i BR, with large BR, 1and 3/4 baths, modern and clean. Yes the elevator's were a little slow but not a big deal. Would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and excellent room”
Reviews.Author: puttputt76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Manhattan Club for a week in August and found the place to be quite adequate in all departments. The location is excellent with quick access to the subways, Central Park is 3 blocks and many shows we were able to walk to. Restaurants near by. There were 2 teenagers and 2 adults and the 1 bedroom suite was ideal with 2 bathrooms. Would definately stay there again and or recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ttinygnome
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on July 24th and 25th, 2007 and found this hotel to be very pleasant. It is in a great central location, being a few blocks walk to Times Square in one direction and a couple of blocks walk to Central Park in the other. The lobby was nice, with an inviting sitting area. The first room they gave us was very spacious and well-appointed, but it smelled of smoke despite being on a non-smoking floor. They quickly gave us another room (room 1425), which was a bit smaller, but still roomy enough for three adults and a baby in a bassinet. It had a king-size bed (very comfortable) and a pull-out couch. The bellman waited with us the whole time and was very friendly and talkative. There was not much of a view (we could see down to the corner where the Wellington Hotel and the Ben Ash Deli is), but we werenâ€™t there for the view. The room was very clean and the bathroom pretty, with nice soaps, lotion, etc. from Bath and Body Works. The kitchen nook had a sink, fridge, microwave and coffee maker and was in a nice modern black. The A/C was powerful and much appreciated! We enjoyed our stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location 10th to 12th Aug”
Reviews.Author: jaBoston
Reviews.Content: we decided to make this trip on impulse simply because we had extra points and believe it ,we found a 1 bedroom suite on line with 10 days notice this was a points exchange,we did not have to call anyone,very costly for 2 nights/ friday to sunday to say the least,but we had to take the opportunity,since it is said its virtualy impossible to get a reservation especially an exchange. checkin was a breeze maybe 3mins this was at 7.30pm we did valet parking did not use the car again until departure of which we called 10mins ahead at found it waiting for us,very nice. indeed checkout was a breeze too .one thing though it gets busy at the lobby ,but they have alternative checkout dropoff points,where you dont have to go to front desk unless you have to.renovations are going on in the front of the clubso there is scaffolding right now,if its anything like the future pics show its going to be beautiful 1 bedroom suite is fair in size not your typical new resort size but fair size with 2 full bathrooms small kitchenette type place with fridge and microwave.there is a surprisingly small tv maybe15 inch in the living rm and bedroom,with cable service.flat screen lcd/plasma would be nice and definately create more space taken by the huge tv cabinets they say they are in the process of upgrading these really old tvs wireless internet was not available in rooms for free ,but if needed you can use internet at the business ctr on the 26th floor,together with gym ,bars ,etc location is unbeatable ,it is worth it for the location alone the suites are not out of this world but comfortable. we did not interact much with staff but the little we did was pleasant no problems like some reviews here ah !!! the elevators ,they are small ,we were in and out of the club alot but the elevators were fast.2 serving main lobby abd i think extra on the side ,service elevators i believe. for all intent and purposes we enjoyed our stay ,but the bills add up,parking ,room service,wireless internet

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: cobs00
Reviews.Content: So far in my traveling journeys, I have had very little bad experiences, and many, many great ones, "The Manhattan Club" being one of them. I was a little weary I must admit after reading quite a few reviews, but after my week stay there, I was quite impressed. So impressed, that I would definately love to come back to this hotel. After being greeted by the delightful hotel staff, we were blown away by our 1 bedroom suite with 2 spacious bathrooms, 2 plasma tv's, a nice size modern room (compared to New York standards), and a very comfortable king size bed. The greatest thing about this hotel is the location. You virtually are in the heart of everything, and if you want to go out further, just roll out of bed right into the subway. Thats how close you are. There is a ton of dining options around you. If you need help finding out a type of food, just check with the concierge, Furthermore, if you want to save a little on food, there is quite a few grocery stores in the area which would be perfect for your mini fridge in your room. Just a heads up, coffee in your rrom costs $2 per pack.. Just go to the grocery store, and buy your coffee, filters, etc. There is a coffee machine there for you use. Maid service is there daily for the mandatory $25 fee you pay per day, and it is worth it coming back to our freshly clean room. There is a business room on the 26th floor with over 6 computer terminals one of them being a a mac. There is also a nice size weight room with pretty modern machinery. I would definately come back here, and not only had an amazing time in New York, but was very impressed with everything as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: webmobile
Reviews.Content: We finally got a trade into the Manhattan Club. The location's great, a block from the subway station, right next to 7th ave and 2 blocks from Central Park. Like in the other reviews that I've read, the front desk people were not friendliest people. Not rude, but expressionless. It was a hit or miss with the elevators. Sometimes the elevator was there within a minute and other times it was so slow that we took the stairs. We were in room 1207 and there's not much of a view unless you like looking at the outside walls of the other units. We had a 1 bedroom suite. The bed was hard and the room was small compared to other timeshares that we stayed in. I was told that all rooms or hotel rooms in Manhattan were small and that this was quite large. We had 2 bathrooms and they were clean and with marbled counters and gold tone fixtures. I thought the room was dark too. The water pressure in the shower was good. There was a kitchenette and we kept sodas in the refrigerator. There were alot of police cars and police on horseback in the area. I felt it was very safe.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful holiday friom a british customer”
Reviews.Author: terrien
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during june and july and can say was dubious following reading various reviews , however we loved it. The hotel staff yes were short with us however helpful to us , probably due to the nature of their job. I was waiting to book in and a "american lady "was complaining that her safe wasnt working and wanted IMMEDIATE action....... get a grip its a safe surely will wait 15 mins. The room was spacious and clean, yes following a comment the windows were slightly dirty however its Manhattan and 20 floors high cant be cleaned every day !!!!!!! The place was central for everything and we hardly were in the room so not as important as if it was in the middle of nowhere. The only people i saw complain were the americans maybe they have different standards to the british but i certainly wouldnt complain about ths place and the service. The lifts yes could be delayed however they were no way as bad as people state also no air con in the business centre however does it matter unless you want to spend all your holiday on the internet. The place was lovely and seem to be a victim of their own success and no doubt will get moans but doesnt everywhere. W have been all over the world as you can nick pick about everywhere This is in the middle of mahattan what more could you ask for 2 streets from central park, broadway , 5 th Avenue and Time square and new yorkers are friendly no matter what people say you smile and talk to them they will be friendly back I would recommend going there and to the manhattan club we waited 9 months and it was well worth the wait. one thing i would say DONT BELIEVE EVERYTHING YOU READ , TAKE A RISK AND USUALLY PAYS OFF .

Reviews.Title: “Horrible timeshare/hotel (Manhattan Club)”
Reviews.Author: sue0616
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 1 week + it was AWFUL!!!! DO NOT EVER GO HERE!! Every employee at the check-in desk + concierge desk was rude and obnoxious and had their hand out for a tip! There were many unhappy guests and owners (timeshare property) in the lobby who hated it + are making it known to management. But management doesn't seem to care! No air conditioning in the lobby or elevators or computer room-- what, are they that cheap?? The whole place needs a re-do, too. The windows were so filthy you couldn't even see outside. Many things were missing from the room at check-in. The bed was awful. The shower barely had any pressure. The only good thing about this place was the location, but it sure was not worth it to stay here. There are hundreds of other places to choose from, + believe me, myself + the many others I spoke with in the lobby will NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN. RCI (the timeshare owner) is being made aware of the very poor quality of the employees + the place itself. STAY AWAY FROM HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Smile ! It won't hurt!”
Reviews.Author: Wheaties
Reviews.Content: We were in Manhattan for a week of site seeing. Check in was prompt, even though we were there 30 minutes before check in time. The bell hop was very helpful with getting our bags loaded onto the luggage cart and delivering them to our room. We had a one bedroom suite facing the street. It was very spacious with room enough for a blow up mattress in the living area. The bathrooms were clean and well stocked with Bath and Body Works products. The downside to this property is that there are 4 elevators and usually only 1 was working. There were times when we stood for 10 min waiting for the elevator on the 18th floor. Other than this we didn't encounter any problems until the morning of check out. We called for a bellhop or a luggage cart, and called for our car to be brought around from the parking garage. After waiting 15 minutes we hauled all of our luggage out to the elevator. After waiting forever for the elevator we finally made it downstairs to be greeted by one of the other guests loudly complaining that he couldn't get his car to the front of the building because ours had been sitting there for 10 min. If the hotel is short staffed they should say so, instead of saying they will send someone up with a luggage cart right away. Also, training on how to smile and be friendly to the guests might be in order. After we checked in the staff virtually ignored us. Other than these minor things, our stay was VERY comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “not nearly as bad as some of the other reviews”
Reviews.Author: 312newswannabe
Reviews.Content: After finding out that I would be staying at the Manhattan Club, I checked this site for the reviews...I was hesitant after most things I read...I basically thought we were going to be staying in a dump, but when we arrived I was pleasantly surprised...The lobby was very clean and the front desk staff were helpful...no rooms were available at the early hour, so we checked our bags with the bellmen...that staff was mostly helpful except for the older Asian man who continually complained about his back hurting...he also acted as if we were an inconvenience when we came back to get our bags...upon entering the room, it was very clean...I was really surprised to see a 32in flat screen mounted to the wall (reception of all local channels sucked, but there were a ton of cable channels that came in great)...the size was great for 2 adults...we had a "jr suite" with the one bed and couch that doubled as a bed...both of which were comfortable...the room even had a little kitchen area with a microwave, sink and dishwasher...plates and all utinsels were included...the in-room safe was in such a position that the door wouldn't open all the way, therefore making it impossible for me to store my laptop while exploring the city...the bathroom was a bit small...there was no counter space at all...I suppose they didn't consider that when people travel, we bring all of our crap and there was no place to put them in the bathroom as the sink was a stand-alone...the shower was decent size, however. Our room looked completely remodeled...there was even FREE WIRELESS INTERNET in the room, which was also a nice surprise...Housekeeping was a charge of $15 daily...they called just about every morning and woke us up to see if we wanted our room cleaned...and some days they called multiple times...that was really annoying, as we couldn't sleep in...The elevators weren't as slow as I was expecting, or as some of the reviews would suggest...there are really only 2 elevators to service the entire hotel...there are also 2 service elevators for guest use...that was a nice secret when the line in the lobby was long...it didn't seem like most people saw the sign for the additional elevators around the corner from the front desk...besides the housekeeping calling, our week long stay was a fine one...the room was great for the most part...I'd recommend it...

HotelInfo.Name: The Manhattan Club
HotelInfo.Address: 200 West 56th Street, New York City, NY 10019
